body:

title: penetration_through_barrier
body:
A character having an orifice ([[pussy|vagina]], [[anus]], mouth) being penetrated by a [[penis]] or [[object insertion|other object]] through a gap too narrow for the character's [[ass]]/head to pass through (e.g. [[fence]], [[bars]], [[cage]]).

Similar to [[glory hole]] but the gap is not a simple hole designed to fit a disembodied penis.

title: walker_(robot)
body:
A type of bipedal (or multipedal) [[non-humanoid robot]] or [[mecha]] frequently used in [[science fiction]] media. 

They usually lack a head or arms and some have [[chicken]]-like legs. The [[AT-ST]] and [[AT-AT]] from [[Star Wars]] are arguably the most recognizable examples of this style of mecha design.

Do not confuse these for regular [[mecha]]s - if it's humanoid it's typically not a walker.

h4. Examples
* !post #7265868: An [[AT-ST]], the typical "chicken walker" style of walker
* !post #7071647: A [[Glaug]], another "chicken walker" type
* !post #7190664: A [[Titan (c&c)|]], a "walking tank" style walker
* !post #4758111: An [[M1A4 Juggernaut]], a multipedal "spider" style walker


h4.  See Also:

* [[Non-humanoid robot]]
* [[Regult]]
* [[Glaug]]
* [[Mad Cat (Battletech)]]

h4. External links

* "TV Tropes: Walking Tank":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingTank]

title: shoes
body:
A covering for the foot, typically with a sturdy sole and a soft upper half, with the cuff not reaching above the ankle.

This tag generally includes any type of closed shoe less than ankle-height, including [[sneakers]], [[loafers]], [[Mary Janes]], [[high heels]], etc. It does not include other types of shoes, such as [[boots]], [[sandals]], [[slippers]], etc, that either go past the ankle, don't cover the whole foot, or aren't made of sturdy material.

title: shirogane_noel_(casual)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shirogane Noel]].

Her casual attire consists of a [[white sweater|white]], [[ribbed sweater|ribbed]] [[off-shoulder sweater]] worn over a [[black tank top]], a [[black choker]] with a [[snowflake pendant|snowflake]] [[pendant]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]], [[brown skirt|brown]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks]] and [[brown shoes]].

In June 1st 2021, she received a variation of her casual attire as a joke for the "World Milk Day":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Milk_Day], which adds a cow [[cow ears|ears]], [[cow horns|horns]] and a [[cow tail|tail]], a [[collared shirt]] with a [[cow print]] and a [[neck bell|neck]] [[cowbell]]. This peculiar attire is a result of Noel embracing all the "cow jokes" resulting from her large breasts.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume one for the regular version and one for the World Milk Day variation:

* [[medium hair|Medium-length]] [[parted hair|Parted]] [[half updo]] with a small [[half up braid]]s held with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]]s and [[choppy bangs|choppy]] [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[fanged bangs]]
* Medium-length hair done in a [[single braid|single]] [[side braid]] held with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15445361: Profile
* !post #4174179: Reference sheet
* !post #6271387: Merchandise
* !post #5444183: World Milk Day variant

title: shirogane_noel_(dirndl)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shirogane Noel]].

It's a [[german clothes|German]]-styled [[maid]] costume (specifically a [[Bavaria]]n beer girl [[dirndl]]) with black [[bowtie]] and [[puffy short sleeves|short]] [[puffy detached sleeves]], a [[brown capelet]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], a [[thigh pouch]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[red shoes]]. She can also wear a cow ears and horns from her "milk day" costume with an addition of an [[ear tag]] bearing her name on her left cow ear.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[parted hair|parted]] [[straight hair]] with [[choppy bangs|choppy]] [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[fanged bangs]] decorated with small white [[hair flower]]s, or [[low twintails|low]] [[low twin braids]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24717725: Profile

title: shirogane_noel_(school_uniform)
body:
The 6th costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Shirogane Noel]], revealed on 19 August 2022.

It is a [[school uniform]], consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[dress shirt]], a [[blue necktie|blue]] [[diagonal-striped necktie]] or a [[blue bowtie|blue]] [[diagonal-striped bowtie]], a [[blue jacket|dark blue]] [[blazer]], a light [[blue jacket|blue]] [[hooded jacket]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|dark blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]], [[white socks]] and [[loafers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[short hair|short]]/[[medium hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[swept bangs|swept]] [[braided bangs]] with [[x hair ornament|crossed]] [[hairclip]]s.

title: shirogane_noel_(5th_costume)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shirogane Noel]], revealed on 25 June 2022.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[off-shoulder shirt]] with a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[sleeveless]] [[black undershirt|black]] [[undershirt]] giving the impression of [[see-through cleavage]], a [[short necktie|short]] [[blue necktie]] held by a [[fleur-de-lis]] [[brooch]], [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[juliet sleeves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[cross-laced shorts]] a [[white skirt|white]] [[overskirt]], a single [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, and [[brown boots|brown]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[ankle boots]] with fleur de lis ornaments. Her [[mace]] is slung to her left by a [[belt]] on her waist.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[long hair]] in a [[half up half down braid]] with a [[ponytail]] tied with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]] with [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[fanged bangs]] decorated with a [[fleur-de-lis]] ornament.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15445366: Profile
* !post #5460425: Reference sheet

title: usada_pekora
body:
A [[rabbit girl]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s third batch "[[hololive Fantasy]]".
Designed by [[Yuuki Hagure]].

Being a rabbit girl, she has [[rabbit ears]] (she also has [[extra ears|regular human ears]]) and a [[rabbit tail]]. She has [[orange eyes|]] or [[red eyes]] with [[rabbit-shaped pupils]], [[short eyebrows|short]] [[thick eyebrows]] shaved into [[hikimayu]], [[small breasts]] and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], [[blue hair|blue]]-and-[[white hair]].

Her default hairstyle is [[parted hair]] into [[twintails|twin]] [[twin braids|braids]] with [[carrot hair ornament]]s, [[sidelocks]] and [[swept bangs]].

body: A system that allows a gunner to operate a weapon (usually a [[machine gun]]) remotely from a safe space, such as inside a vehicle. The most common feature with these systems include a [[video camera]] featuring a large optical lens.

title: tensei_shitara_dai_nana_oji_datta_no_de:_kimama_ni_majutsu_o_kiwamemasu
body:
A fantasy web novel by Kenkyo na Circle (謙虚なサークル "X Account":[https://x.com/ofkenkyo]) and illustrated by [[merueto|Meru]] in the light novel version. Also adapted as manga, anime and game. 

h4.Story
The male protagonist is reincarnated as [[Lloyd de Saloum]], the seventh prince, in another world. With not much else to do, he decides perfecting his magic skills. But will he really be left alone, or will trouble arise?

h4. Characters
* [[Lloyd de Saloum]]

title: batman_vs._teenage_mutant_ninja_turtles
body: Batman vs. Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is an American animated superhero film directed by Jake Castorena and written by Marly Halpern-Graser. Inspired by the [[DC Comics]] and IDW Publishing comic book miniseries [[Batman]]/[[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]] by James Tynion IV and Freddie Williams II, the story focuses on Batman, Robin, and Batgirl teaming up with the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in order to save Gotham City from chaos at the hands of both Shredder and [[Ra's al Ghul]]. Produced by Warner Bros. Animation in association with DC Entertainment and [[Nickelodeon]].

title: joker_(dc)
body:
[[Batman|Batman's]] archnemesis and the main antagonist of [[DC comics]]' [i][[batman (series)|Batman]][/i] series and movies. A maniacal clown with green hair, bleached skin and a grotesque grin, Joker is a brilliant criminal mastermind and expert chemist who specializes in weaponized props and toxins. He is also a murderous psychopath with a horrific sense of humor and a pathological obsession with Batman.

The Joker is created by the late Bob Kane, the late Bill Finger, and the late Jerry Robinson and first appeared in [i]Batman[/i] #1 (April 25, 1940).

One of the most recognized characters in popular culture, the Joker has been listed among the greatest comic book villains and fictional characters ever created. His likeness has appeared on merchandise such as clothing and collectible items, and he has inspired real-world structures (such as theme park attractions) and been referenced in various media. The Joker has been adapted in live-action, animated, and video game incarnations.

h4. Notable Incarnations
* The Joker ([[Batman: the Animated Series]]) - The Joker as portrayed in the DC Animated Universe
* [[Arthur Fleck]] - Civilian identity in the [i][[joker (2019)|JOKER]][/i] continuity
* [[Jerome Valeska]] and [[Jeremiah Valeska]] - Civilian identities in the [i][[Gotham (series)]][/i] continuity
other_names: ジョーカー(バットマン)

title: bruno_(fire_emblem)
body:
Bruno, initially identified as the Mysterious Man, is a secondary antagonist in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]]. He is an enigmatic man who occasionally appears before the Order of Heroes.

He is a prince of Embla, he and his mother were despised by the royal family. Eventually claiming she shared imperial secrets with Askr, they imprisoned her, causing her to die in isolation, while he himself was banished to the border despite only being a child.

In his first appearance in Chapter 9, he faces the Order of Heroes at first, but eventually aids them, as he warns about Veronica's attack on their summoning grounds. Later, he claims to have knowledge about Zacharias, but refuses to say anything more before disappearing.

[spoilers]In reality, he IS Zacharias, which was an alias used by Bruno to get closer to the Askran royal family.[/spoilers]

title: fantastic_four_(2015_film)
body:
[b]Fantastic Four[/b] (stylized as [b]FANT4STIC[/b]) is a 2015 superhero film based on the [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]] [[Fantastic Four|team of the same name]]. Directed by Josh Trank, who co-wrote the screenplay with Jeremy Slater and Simon Kinberg, it stars Miles Teller, Michael B. Jordan, Kate Mara, Jamie Bell and Toby Kebbell. The film follows a group of intelligent teenagers who build a transdimensional portal, causing them to gain superhuman abilities.

Fantastic Four premiered at Williamsburg Cinemas in New York City on August 4, 2015, and was released on August 7 in the United States. The film received negative reviews from critics and was considered a box-office bomb, grossing $167.9 million worldwide against a production budget of $120 million, with an estimated loss between $80–$100 million for the studio. Fantastic Four received several Golden Raspberry Awards, including Worst Director and Worst Picture. Trank also voiced his displeasure with the final film, which he attributed to production studio [[20th Century Studios|20th Century Fox]]'s interference.

title: gundam_f91
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam F91[/b] (Japanese: 機動戦士ガンダムF91フォーミュラ ナインティワン, Hepburn: [i]Kidou Senshi Gandamu Foumyura Nainti Wan[/i], [b]Mobile Suit Gundam Formula 91[/b]) is a 1991 anime film set in the [[Gundam]] universe. 

It was written and directed by [[mobile_suit_gundam|original Gundam]] creator [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]. It was Tomino's attempt to launch a new U.C. Gundam saga, set 30 years after [[Char's Counterattack]]. He re-teamed with character designer [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]] and [[mecha]] designer [[Ookawara Kunio]]  for the occasion.

Originally planned as a full-length television series, Gundam F91 hit a production snag due to staff disputes, and the project was stopped after the screenplays for the first thirteen episodes were written. It was then decided that what was made of the show would be condensed into a theatrical feature. The film was first released in [[Japan]] on March 16, 1991.

Set in [b]U.C. 0123[/b] (44 years after [[mobile_suit_gundam|the original Gundam]]), the story of Gundam F91 revolves around teenage space colonist [[Seabook Arno]], his girlfriend [[Cecily Fairchild]], and the efforts of the [[Crossbone Vanguard]] militia to establish an aristocracy known as "Cosmo Babylonia". In keeping with Gundam tradition, the civilian Seabook is forced by circumstance to pilot the [[F91 Gundam]], coincidentally designed in part by his estranged mother, Dr. [[Monica Arno]].

Chronologically continued by [[Crossbone Gundam]] and [[Victory Gundam]].

h4. External links
* "Official Film OP":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cYH899IzY9g

title: area_15
body:
[[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] group name for the first-generation members of [[hololive Indonesia]] (namely [[Ayunda Risu]], [[Moona Hoshinova]], and [[Airani Iofifteen]]). The name is a play on ""Area 51":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Area_51#UFO_and_other_conspiracy_theories]" due to the general extraterrestrial theme of their characters (which is admittedly more subtle in Risu's case), combined with the fact that their birthdays are all on the 15th of different months.

title: holox
body:
The 6th batch of [[virtual youtuber|VTubers]] from [[hololive]], dubbed  as "holoX" (pronounced "holoks"). Their theme is a secret organization. To fit with the "secrecy" theme, Cover co. announced the group's existence only 9 hours before the first member, [[La+ Darknesss]], debuted on 26 November 2021.

Also worth noting is that unlike [[hololive Fantasy]] (3rd gen) and [[holoForce]] (4th gen), holoX marks the first time since [[hololive Gamers]] that a hololive JP talent group starts out with a name of their own, a tradition normally associated only with [[hololive English]].

[u]Use this tag when:[/u]

title: m1_bazooka
body:
This name originally referred to the American World War II rocket launcher known as the M1, which got the name Bazooka because it reminded American infantry of the tubular musical instrument invented and popularized by U.S. radio comedian Bob Burns in the 1930s. It is now used as a generic term for any manner of tube-like shoulder-fired rocket launcher, but that's not what the Danbooru tag is for.

Developed by the [[United States Army]] and approved for service in 1940, the M1 Bazooka was the first of its kind: using a rocket (rather than an anti-tank rifle or a handheld grenade) to shoot a shaped charge at enemy tanks. The Bazooka saw extensive use on all fronts of the war, used against enemy bunkers, pillboxes, fortified positions, and even tanks. 

After the disastrous Battle of Kasserine Pass in early 1943, many examples of the Bazooka fell into German hands. Impressed with the innovative idea, the Germans copied the Bazooka wholesale, enlarging the rocket and adding a shield to the tube to protect the shooter from backblast, calling the new weapon the [[panzerschreck]], or "tank terror".


h4. See also

* [[rocket launcher]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

* [[bazooka_(gundam)]]
* [[yae_bazooka]]
* [[chrysm_bazooka]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Bazooka":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bazooka

title: anime_coloring
body:
A 2D rendering technique consisting of hard-edge shading, as opposed to any soft-edge coloring techniques, such as those prominent in [[painterly]] styles. 

It is the most common technique in 2D anime production. 

For the similar technique employed in artworks that are [[3D]] - or that intentionally mimic 3D media - see [[cel rendering]].

title: ishuzoku_reviewers
body:
[b]Ishuzoku Reviewers[/b] (異種族レビュアーズ, lit. "Interspecies Reviewers") is a manga series written by [[amahara (amahara teikoku)|Amahara]] and illustrated by [[masha]], first published in 2014, about reviewing brothels run by and filled with various girls of varied race. Undead, elves, demons, faeries all judged in their ability to satisfy by an assembly of three fantasy races and a human.

An anime adaptation debuted on January 2020, which became controversial due to its explicit sexual content, most notably [[prostitution]]. The anime was banned by mainstream networks in Japan and pulled from Funimation's website after being aired for only 3 episodes. In response, the website [i]MyAnimeList[/i] was flooded with positive reviews, which temporarily turned the show into the highest rated anime of all time on the site.

title: rocket_launcher
body:
A [b]man-portable[/b] [[weapon]] that fires a rocket-propelled projectile at a target. This tag is a catch-all term for any types of them, including [[multishot rocket launcher]]s, man-portable air-defense systems (MANPADs), anti-tank systems, and more. Because missiles they fire are considered as guided rockets.

For tagging purpose and despite the technical distinctions, [b]recoilless rifle[/b] is aliased into rocket launcher due to identical external appearance of the specific models and the same purpose of both weapon classes.

See [[missile pod]] for [[military vehicle|vehicle]] mounted rocket and [[missile]] systems.

h4. List of rocket launchers

* [[AT4]]
* [[Carl Gustaf recoilless rifle]]

title: mayday_parker
body:
[[Marvel]] character from the [[Spider-Man (series)|]] series. The daughter of [[Peter Parker]] and [[Mary Jane Watson]], who inherits her father's powers and takes up the superhero mantle of [[Spider-Girl]] in the Earth-982 continuity.

A version of Mayday appears as a [[baby]] in [[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]].

For Peter and Mary Jane's superhero daughter from Earth-18119 see [[Anna-May Parker]].

title: spider-girl
body:
[[Marvel]] superhero. There are three incarnations of Spider-Girl, who wears a [[superhero costume]] derivative of Spider-Man.

* [[Mayday Parker]] - [[Peter Parker]] and [[Mary Jane Watson]]'s daughter in Earth-982.
* [[Anya Corazon]] - formerly the Spider-Girl of Earth-616. Originally introduced as [[arana (marvel)|Araña]], a title she has returned to using.
* Petra Parker - a [[genderswap (mtf)|female]] version of Peter Parker from a [[genderswap]]ped alternate universe in the [[Ultimate Spider-Man]] cartoon.

h4. See Also

* [[Spider-Gwen]] - [[Gwen Stacy]]'s Spider-hero identity in Earth-65. Also known as [b]Ghost Spider[/b].
* [[Silk (marvel)|]] - [[Cindy Moon]]'s Spider-hero identity in Earth-616.
* [[Spider-Woman]] - [[Jessica Drew]]'s superhero persona.

title: stomach
body:
An exposed frontal abdomen, specifically the area around the [[navel]] and above the [[groin]]. For images pertaining to the internal organ itself, use [[stomach_(organ)]].

Should only be used when the stomach is a prominent, noticeable part of the image, not merely in the background or partially exposed.

Unlike [[midriff]], [[stomach]] can be used when the stomach is visible between [[underwear]], [[bikini]]s, and when the character is [[nude]], [[bottomless]], or [[topless female]]/[[topless male]].

When the towel is only being used to cover the front, use [[nude cover]] instead. If it is only worn around the neck, use [[nude]] with [[towel around neck]].

title: bottomless
body:
Nude from the waist down. Wearing a top, but no bottoms. 

For example, wearing a [[shirt]] or other top without any [[pants]], [[underwear]], or other bottom clothing.

When considering if a character qualifies the post for this tag, follow the rules below.

h5. Rules for usage

* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is fully [[nude]].
* [b]Do not use[/b] when you can't see the character's upper body. You should be able to tell the character is wearing a top.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is wearing [[panties]] or [[underwear]]. Use [[no pants]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is wearing a [[skirt]] or [[dress]] without underwear. Use [[no panties]] or [[no male underwear]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is pulling their [[panties]] or [[underwear]] down or aside.
* [b]Do not use[/b] when the character is only wearing a [[pantyhose]]. In this case, use both [[no pants]] and [[no panties]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] for [[monster girl]]s or [[monster boy]]s who don't normally wear clothing from the waist up. Use [[nude]] instead.
* [b]Do not use[/b] [[bare legs]] with this tag.
* Wearing [[garter belt]], [[garter straps]], [[maebari]], [[thighhighs]], [[socks]], or [[shoes]] still counts as [[bottomless]].
* If you can't tell that the character isn't wearing [[underwear]], use [[no pants]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #18256: Basic bottomless
* !post #52206: Bottomless one-piece swimsuit
* !post #114711: No bikini bottom
* !post #8814138: Bottomless with thighhighs

h4. See also

* [[No panties]]
* [[No pants]]
* [[No male underwear]]
* [[Topless female]]
* [[Topless male]]
* [[Topless other]]
* [[Tag group:Sexual attire]]

title: male_swimwear_challenge
body:
Art challenge where a female character is made to wear [[male swimwear]], either [[jammers]] or [[swim trunks]], while also [[topless female|topless]] and in a public space such as a [[beach]] or [[pool]]. [[reverse trap|Works best]] with an [[androgynous]]-looking [[short hair|short-haired]] female character with a [[tomboy|boyish]] haircut and a [[flat chest]] or [[small breasts]], but art featuring obviously female characters with longer hair and/or larger busts can also suffice, possibly for definite titillation of the viewer and [[embarrassed|embarrassment]] for the subject. [[Tomboy]]s are frequently used as subjects to emphasize their masculine personalities.

While art of girls in male swimwear have been around for quite some time, the first direct response to the challenge appears to have been from November 21, 2020 on Twitter and Pixiv with post #4212758 (originally uploaded to Pixiv on the said date).

This tag can only be applied for direct art responses uploaded on Twitter or any art site on or after November 21, 2020. While the "男水着チャレンジ" tag is also being retroactively added to art uploaded prior to the said date on Pixiv, Nico Nico, and the like which appear to follow the concept, it is discouraged to do so here since it is highly likely the retroactive tag additions in said art sites are just mere afterthoughts.

h4. See also

* [[crossdressing]]
* [[exhibitionism]]

This tag could also be used for the implied removal of clothing, such as when the bottoms or top that a character would normally wear are not depicted on the character. Which could also be tagged as [[topless female]]/[[topless male]] or [[bottomless]].

title: monokini
body:
In modern terminology, a [b]monokini[/b] is a type of [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece]] [[swimsuit]] where the swimsuit is only connected in the front by the conjoining swimsuit. In detail, there are large [[clothing cutout|cutout]]s around the sides and generally [[backless outfit|less coverage from the back]]. It's a more aesthetic look to the one-piece swimsuit being a combination to that of a [[bikini]] and one-piece.

The earliest term of monokini originates in the mid-1960s, designed by Rudi Gernreich, where it was first introduced as a [[topless female|topless]] swimsuit with two shoulder straps. This term has since became obsolete in the later years, but some modern topless monokini still exist alongside the one-piece monokinis.

h4. Do not confuse

* If pulled down anywhere up to about just below the breasts, use [[shirt pull]].

* If breasts are visible for other reasons, use [[breasts out]] or [[bare pectorals]] for male characters
* If the top is missing altogether, use [[topless female]] or [[topless male]] for male characters

body:

Featuring a female humanoid armed with two pairs of twin-barreled turrets on her clawed gauntlets and two pairs of triple-barreled turrets attached to the bracing on her legs. Unlike both [[Southern Ocean Oni]] and [[Southern Ocean War Oni]], she is [[topless female|topless]] and wears a [[crotch plate]] and armored legging on her left leg. She wears her long silvery hair tied in [[twintails]] with the bangs [[hair over one eye|over her right eye]]. Sharing the "war" title with [[Southern Ocean War Oni]], their hair ties have a fiery glow.

title: topless_female
body:
Nude from the waist up. Not wearing a top, but wearing bottoms. For example, wearing [[pants]] or a [[skirt]] without a [[shirt]] or [[bra]].

h6. Guidelines

* Don't use when the character is [[nude]] or [[completely nude]].
* Don't use when you can't see the character's lower body. You should be able to tell the character is wearing bottom clothing. Use [[nude]] instead.
* Don't use if the character is wearing a [[bra]] or [[bikini top only|bikini top]]. Use [[no shirt]] instead.
* Don't use [[bare shoulders]], [[bare back]], or [[bare arms]] with this tag.
* Don't use this tag for male characters. [[Topless female]] is for female characters only. See [[topless male]] for male characters.
* Don't use for [[monster girl]]s who don't normally wear bottom clothing. Use [[nude]] instead.
* Don't use this tag if the character is wearing only a [[corset]].
* Wearing [[pasties]] or [[bondage]] still counts as topless.

* Don't use if the character is wearing a [[jacket]], [[coat]], [[overalls]] etc without a [[shirt]]. Use [[no shirt]] instead if they're wearing it with lower-body clothing, or the appropriate [[naked_*]] tags (like [[naked jacket]]) if they're only wearing that article of clothing.

title: interface_headset_(evangelion)
body:
A device worn on the heads of [[neon_genesis_evangelion|Evangelion]] pilots in addition to their [[plugsuit (evangelion)|plugsuits]].

A standard interface headset consists of a low-profile headband with a pod at either end. The headset goes around the back of the wearer's head from underneath the hair, with only the two pods appearing in plain sight.

It is likely due to a misunderstanding of this construction that they are sometimes (mistakenly) referred to as "A10 nerve clips", being confused for [[hairclip]]s. There are no canonical materials suggesting that the device has anything directly to do with A10 nerve synchronization, and only [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]] wears an interface headset in the form of an actual pair of separate hairclips.

h4. External links

* "Interface Headset - EvaWiki":[https://wiki.evageeks.org/Interface_Headset]
other_names: インタフェイスヘッドセット

title: multicolored_clothes
body:
Clothing that prominently features two or more distinct colors. For example, a red-and-blue dress.

* White, black, and grey don't count. For example, blue-and-white striped thighhighs don't count.
* Multiple shades of the same color don't count. For example, a light-blue-and-dark-blue shirt doesn't count.
* Trim, bows, or other decorations don't count.
* Simple two-color [[argyle]], [[plaid]], [[polka dot]], [[checkered]], [[gradient]], print, or other patterns that have their own tags don't count.

In essence, multicolored clothes need to have unusual colors and styles that pop out visually to the viewer.

h4. Examples

title: planet
body:
A large spherical astronomical object that typically [[in orbit| orbit]]s a [[star (sky)|]]. The tag should be used when at least one planet is seen from outer [[space]] or from the surface of another nearby planet. This includes real and fictional planets.  

Scientifically, there has always been some ambiguity as to what constitutes a planet, with some celestial bodies such as [[Pluto (planet)|]] and Ceres being considered at different times or by different people either as planets or as "dwarf planets". The International Astronomical Union (IAU) came up with a definition for a planet in 2006, meaning that the planets in our solar system are officially [[Mercury_(planet)|]], [[Venus (planet)|]], [[Earth (planet)|]], [[Mars_(planet)|]], [[Jupiter (planet)|]], [[Saturn (planet)|]], [[Uranus (planet)|]] and [[neptune (planet)|]], but the definition remains contentious.

title: girls'_frontline_2:_exilium
body:
A Chinese smartphone and PC game developed by Mica Team. A sequel to the original [[Girls' Frontline]], set ten years after the starting events of that game. Nicknamed the "anime [[X-COM]]", due to its adoption of its gameplay style.

Unlike the first game, each 'Tactical Doll' is now given a proper name, instead of using a codename based on their imprinted weapon of choice.

She usually wears a black [[crop top]] [[black tank top|tank top]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] that shows her [[midriff]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[black thighhighs]], and a [[black cloak|black]] [[hooded cloak]].

She is voiced by [[Amamiya Sora]].

title: project_kv
body:
An abandoned multimedia project that was to be developed by DynamisOne and Studio Alaya. The project had been given the nickname "[[Blue Archive]] with Swords" or "Red Archive" due to not only sharing a similar theme of school girls with [[halo]]s and weapons, but is made by several former Blue Archive developers.

It was initially teased on August 18th, 2024, before a promo video officially revealed it on September 1st, with a visual novel planned for [[Comiket 105]], and a gacha game speculated to release in the future. The project has been "cancelled":[https://x.com/DynamisOne/status/1832722210160554111] on September 8th, 2024, speculated to be due to both controversy surrounding accusations of plagiarism, and a suspected threat of a copyright infringement lawsuit from [[Nexon]], Blue Archive's publisher.

Peculiarly, since the project's announcement, it has spawned a trend of [[futanari]] fanarts. This trend stemmed from the Korean community, where it was joked that the project would be more popular if it involved "cockfighting" rather than "sword fighting". The original jokes originated from joking KV stood for the Korean slang words "kochu" (sword) and "valgi" (sword drawing), which is used for [[penis]] and [[erection]], respectively.

On February 27th, 2025, it was revealed that the project was originally developed by Nexon, titled "MX Blade," serving as a side story to Blue Archive in production years before Blue Archive was released. With the aftermath of the incident induced by Dynamis One, this original project has since been shelved. Dynamis One would respond on March 18th, however by that point the relevant team members were already in captivity before the announcement post was even shared with the public. 

h4. External links

* "Official Site (Shut Down)":[https://www.projectkv.co.kr]
* "Official Twitter":[https://twitter.com/DynamisOne]
* "Link regarding the Investigation":[https://biz.chosun.com/en/en-it/2025/02/26/IHEHBR5SAJADPM4S62EXRXJD6Y]"
* "Dynamis One's response to the Incident":[https://www.gameple.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=212071]"

title: shoushimin_series
body:
A mystery novel series by Yonezawa Honobu (米澤穂信) that was first published in December 2004 by Sougen Suiri Bunko (litetally called [i]Petit Bourgeoisie[/i]). There is a Summer 2024 anime adaptation by [i]Lapin Track[/i]. 

[[Kobato Jougorou]] is a boy who wanted to reduce his habit of deducting and over-analyzing everything, [[Osanai Yuki]] is a girl who is avoided by others because of her strange tendencies. Both of them desire nothing more than to have a simple and peaceful high school life. This is a story about two people who are aiming and working together to be [i]inconspicuous citizens[/i] (petit bourgeois).

h4. Characters

* [[Kobato Jougorou]]
* [[Osanai Yuki]]

title: nekomata_okayu_(oversized_shirt)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Nekomata Okayu]].

Known as her "oversized shirt" (or "boyfriend's shirt" in Japanese) costume from [i]hololive Closet[/i], it consists of an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket]] worn over a [[partially unbuttoned]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]] and a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[no pants]]. Her shirt has a couple of [[button gap]]s, which reveal that she's apparently [[no bra|not wearing a bra]]. She also wears a [[slippers]] with a [[dog print]] on it; matching with [[Inugami Korone|Korone]]'s cat print slippers.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[medium hair|medium]] [[messy hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair|on the inside]] and [[diagonal bangs]] (although many artist often omit this detail and draw her with [[blunt bangs]] or just messy bangs instead).

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25246273: Profile
* !post #4768996: Merchandise (without glasses)
* !post #4820795: Merchandise (with glasses)

h4. See also

* [[Ogyayu (nekomata okayu)|]] - an unofficial variant of this outfit depicting Okayu as a [[gyaru]]

title: last_defense_academy_school_uniform
body:
The battle uniform from [[The Hundred Line -Last Defense Academy-]], worn while the wearer is under the effects of hemoanima. 

The standard male uniform is a [[gakuran]] composed of a [[black jacket|black]] [[jacket]] and [[black pants|black]] [[pants]]. 

The standard female uniform is a [[black serafuku|black]] [[serafuku]] with a [[black sailor collar|black]] [[sailor collar]], a [[white neckerchief|white]] [[neckerchief]], a [[white bodysuit|white]] [[bodysuit]] worn [[bodysuit under clothes|under the serafuku]], and a [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]].

Common elements of the uniform include [[long sleeves]], a [[white armband|white]] [[armband]], [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]], and a glowing [[hole in chest|hole in the chest]].

h4. External links
* "The Hundred Line Wiki: Hemoanima":https://the-hundred-line.fandom.com/wiki/Hemoanima

title: witch_(left_4_dead)
body:
The only non-playable special [[zombie|infected]] that counts as a boss in the [[Left 4 Dead]] series.

The Witch is a pale zombie who has dangerously sharp nails. The Witch will only be provoked when the survivors are close to her, flashing light on her or when she gets shot.

title: fushiguro_megumi
body:
A character from [[Jujutsu Kaisen]]. Megumi is a first-year student at Tokyo Jujutsu High alongside [[Itadori Yuuji]] and [[Kugisaki Nobara]]. He is the son of [[Fushiguro Touji]], who formerly belonged to the Zen'in Clan, and younger step-brother of [[Fushiguro Tsumiki]].

As a blood member of one of the three great clans, he was born with the innate talent of making use of the Ten Shadows Technique, in addition, given an agreement between his father and [[Zen'in Naobito]], if Megumi is deprived of custody of [[Gojou Satoru]], Megumi would become the next head of the Zen'in Clan.

title: flexible
body:
Referring to the ability to perform positions requiring a higher amount of body mobility than the average human has. This can be achieved through [[stretching]] or [[yoga]]. If the position requires extreme levels of flexibility this act will be referred to as [[contortion]] instead.

h4. Disciplines requiring flexibility:

* [[Martial arts]]
** [[Karate]]
** [[Taekwondo]]

title: non_non_biyori
body:
[b]Non Non Biyori[/b] is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Atto. An anime adaptation by [[Silver Link]] began airing in October 2013 followed by a second season in July 2015 and a final season in January 2021.

The story takes place in the countryside village of Asahigaoka, where many conveniences are several miles away and the school consists of only five students, each of whom come from different grades of elementary and middle school. [[Ichijou Hotaru]], a fifth grader from Tokyo, transfers into Asahigaoka Branch School and adjusts to countryside life with her new friends.

title: jr_211_series
body:
The 211 series (211系) is a DC suburban [[Multiple Unit Train|Electric Multiple Unit]] [[Train]] that was introduced in 1985. It was originally designed and manufactured by [[Japan Railways|Japanese National Railways (JNR)]], and after [[Japan Railways|JNR]] was divided and privatized, Operated by [[East Japan Railway Company|East Japan Railway Company (JR East)]], [[Central Japan Railway Company|Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central)]], and Formerly Operated in [[West Japan Railway Company|West Japan Railway Company (JR West)]].

title: sonic_cd
body:
A [[1993]] video game developed by [[Sega]] for the [[Sega CD]]. Developed by [[Sonic Team]], it is the third installment in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] Series, along with [[Toei Animation]], who helped make the intro. Known for having two distinct soundtracks, one released in Japan and Europe, the other being released in North America.

[[Metal Sonic]] and [[Amy Rose]] made their video game debuts in this game.

title: paladin
body: The middle french loanword "paladin" or "palatine" historically comes from latin adjective word: "palatinus"  (plural: palatini), meaning "relating to the palace" which are originally referred to the palace guards of the palatine hill during the roman period, and later referred to a "count palatine" a high-level official attached to imperial or royal courts to perform the administrative tasks

title: kanojo_x_kanojo_x_kanojo
body:
[b]Kanojo × Kanojo × Kanojo: San Shimai to no Dokidoki Kyoudou Seikatsu[/b] (彼女×彼女×彼女～三姉妹とのドキドキ共同生活～) is an eroge visual novel by Crossnet, first released 2008, with art by [[Happoubi Jin]].

The main title has also been romanized as [i]Kanojyo × Kanojyo × Kanojyo[/i].

Further products in the series include:

* a 2009 sequel game, entitled [i]Kanojo × Kanojo × Kanojo: Dokidoki Full Throttle![/i] (彼女×彼女×彼女 ドキドキフルスロットル！);
* a 2009 OVA by Milky Animation Label, entitled [i]Kanojo × Kanojo × Kanojo: San Shimai to no Dokidoki Kyoudou Seikatsu[/i] like the original game.

h4. Characters

body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0327 in the National Pokédex, a Normal-type.

A bipedal [[panda]] Pokémon with [[rabbit]]-like features. Has [[spiral-only eyes]], along with five red [[spotted_fur|spots]] on its head (two on its face, one on the back, and one on each ear).

The chances of two Spinda having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion. [tn](official description)[/tn]

title: irys_(irys_1.0)_(hololive)
body:
The old design of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[IRyS (hololive)|]].

Her original form had five four-pointed [[star (symbol)|]]s (three black and two white) above her head as a halo of sorts. Her outfit consisted of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[gradient dress|gradient]] [[white dress|white]] to [[black dress]], with [[see-through cleavage]], a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[black skirt|black]] [[frilled skirt]] with a [[rose]] her left hip, [[mismatched gloves|mismatched]] [[black gloves|black]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves|elbow-length]] [[bridal gauntlets]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[asymmetrical legwear]] (a [[black pantyhose|black]] [[single leg pantyhose]] on her left leg and a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white]] on her right, [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]].

h4. Appearance

title: irys_(irys_2.0)_(hololive)
body:
The current default costume of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[IRyS (Hololive)|]], revealed in November 2022. 

Technically an update over her original form, it consists of a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[heart brooch]],  [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[juliet sleeves]], [[purple thighhighs]] with a [[gradient legwear|gradient]], and [[red shoes|red]] [[strappy heels]]. She also wears a black frilled dress under the main white dress.

h4. Appearance

title: irys_(gaming_casual)_(hololive)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[IRyS (hololive)|]].

It consists of a [[black serafuku]] consisting of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[double-breasted]] [[black shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]] and a [[red neckerchief]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]], and [[white sneakers]].  The costume also includes an optional [[aqua jacket|aqua]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[short over long sleeves]], [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]] that can have normal or [[coke-bottle glasses|coke-bottle]] lenses and a [[headset]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] is [[long hair]] tied in [[low twintails|low]] [[twin braids]] that go [[hair over shoulder|over the shoulder]] and [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[choppy bangs|choppy]] [[center-flap bangs]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25242070: Profile
* !post #7159533: Reference sheet
* !post #7303623: Merchandise

title: irys_(casualrys)_(hololive)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[IRyS (hololive)|]].

It consists of a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]] with a [[sparkle print]] and a [[hat bow|bow]], a [[black choker|black]] [[lace-trimmed choker]], a [[GuyRyS]] [[necklace]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[lace-trimmed dress|lace trim]], [[spaghetti strap]]s and [[empire waist]], an [[open cardigan|open]] [[brown cardigan|brown]]  [[cable knit]] [[hooded cardigan]] with [[puffy long sleeves]] and [[horns through hood|cutouts for her horns]], a [[black pantyhose]], [[brown boots]]. She also has a [[bracelet]], a [[wristwatch]], [[mismatched earrings|mismatched]] [[flower earrings]] and optional [[glasses]].

On April 2024 she got an optional [[black capelet|black]] [[fur-trimmed capelet|fur-trimmed]] [[hooded capelet]] with a [[rabbit hood]] and a large [[pink bowtie]].

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this outfit:
* [[Short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[swept bangs|swept]] [[choppy bangs]] and a [[side braid]]
* [[Medium hair|Medium]] [[wavy hair]] in a [[side ponytail]] with [[swept bangs]] held with a  pair of [[hairclip]]s
* [[Very long hair]] in the same [[twintails]] style [[self-borrowed hairstyle|borrowed]] from her [[irys (new year) (hololive)|New Year costume]]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25242068: Profile
* !post #6783032: Reference sheet

title: yashiro_nene
body:
One of the protagonists from [[Jibaku Shounen Hanako-kun]], alongside [[Hanako (jibaku_shounen_hanako-kun)|]] and [[Minamoto Kou]].

Due to a curse enacted upon her during the start of the series, any contact with water [spoiler] turns her into a [[yashiro_nene_(fish)|fish]][/spoiler].

* !post #5988341: Official art

Yashiro is known to be earnest and outgoing; her kindness, however, can border into naiveté. This sometimes leaves her vulnerable to exploitation.

Her Japanese VA is [[Kitou Akari]].

title: award_ribbon
body:
A [[ribbon]], often made of [[satin]] or grosgrain, that is given as a prize or recognition for achievement in a [[competition]] or event. They come in various forms and carry different meanings depending on their design and context.

Not to be confused with [[shoulder sash]].

h4. See also

* [[medal]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ribbon (award)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ribbon_(award)]

title: akihabara_dennou_gumi
body:
"Cyber Team in Akihabara"

A 1998 anime series by Ashi Productions.

title: hanying:_zitherwoe_(pgr)
body:
The A rank Omniframe of [[Hanying (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Her Zitherwoe frame has [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[red eyes]] and dark [[green hair]], overall hair length is unknown as her hair is usually tied in an [[updo]] with [[hair stick]]s and a [[Chinese hairpin]]. Has two moles one [[mole under each eye|under each eye]], wears [[red eyeliner]] makeup, a [[single earring|single]] red [[ofuda earrings|ofuda earring]] on her left ear, and a [[gold necklace|gold]] [[pendant]] with a [[green gemstone]]/[[jade (gemstone)|]] as the centerpiece on her neck.

She wears a [[green dress|green]] and [[black dress|black]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[high-low dress]] witha [[bamboo print|print]] [[print dress|print]]) and [[side slit]]s . Wears a pair of [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]] over a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], the glove itself is also [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] with the index and thumb exposed. Wears a pair of [[white shoes|white]] and [[green shoes|green]] [[gradient shoes|gradient]] [[high heels]].

Uses a [[folding fan|folding]] [[hand fan]] as her weapon ([[Tessen]]). 

Depending on the awaken level, her dress can be green and [[white dress|white]] instead, and with [[black thighhighs|black]] [[gradient legwear|gradient thighhighs]] instead of [[bare legs]].

h4. List of appearances/[[official alternate costume]]s
* !post #7218801: Default
* !post #6114319: [[hanying: zitherwoe (heartseeker) (pgr)|Heartseeker]]

Analogue of [[elbow rest]], but when particular attention is drawn to the [[ass]].

When creating a similar effect by holding it or framing it with hands, this becomes instead [[ass support]].

title: son_gohan
body:
The first son of [[Son Goku]] and [[Chi-chi (dragon ball)|]] in [[Dragon Ball]]. He is named after Goku's adoptive grandfather [[Grandpa Gohan]].

Gohan is the first half-[[Saiyan]] of the series, and as such he inherited the fighting prowess of his father while being less "battle eager" due to his mother. He is later on married with [[Videl]] and had a daughter named [[Pan (dragon ball)|]].

Like the other male members of the Goku family, Gohan is voiced by [[Nozawa Masako]].

title: pan_(dragon_ball)
body:
[[Dragon Ball]] character. First appearance being as a child at the end of the original manga series, while she had a major role in [[Dragon Ball GT]]. Pan is the only daughter of [[Son Gohan]] and [[Videl]], [[Son Goten]]'s niece, and [[Son Goku]], [[Chi-Chi (dragon ball)|]], and [[Mr. Satan]]'s granddaughter. Her name is derived from the Japanese term for "bread" (the Son family), the Greek god Pan (Mr. Satan and Videl) and the pan flute ([[Piccolo]]), creating a multilayered name befitting Toriyama's style.

title: takamiya_mana
body:
She is a character from [[Date a Live]] series, and is [[Itsuka Shidou]]'s biological little sister. She is a temporary Second Lieutenant of the AST, and she used to work for the DEM Industries base in England as a Wizard.

Mana appears to be around the age of a middle-school girl. She has long blue hair, tied up in a ponytail, with some bangs left out. She has brown eyes and a mole under her left eye. She resembles Shido a lot, as stated by Tohka.

When she is at the JGSDF base, she wears a military uniform. Due to her young age, however, it gives others the impression that she's cosplaying.

During combat, she wears a light blue CR-Unit. After joining Ratatoskr, she wears a black and blue CR-Unit vaguely resembling a wolf's fangs and claws.

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Mana Takamiya":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Mana_Takamiya

title: ea-nasir
body:
A mid-18th century BCE merchant who lived in Ur, Mesapotamia. He is most well-known today for a customer complaint written on a tablet, which accused him of selling bad copper.

Online, due to no record of his appearance existing, he is often represented with the Sumerian statue known as ""Standing male worshiper":[https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/323735]," which predates Ea-Nasir by 10 centuries and is often used in Bronze Age memes in general (akin to  the statue of mid-ninth century BC Neo-Hittite King "Šuppiluliuma II":[https://www.flickr.com/photos/carolemage/51019854483/]).

title: 2137_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from the Polish Internet. It's a reference to [[Pope John Paul II]]'s time of death (21:37 on April 2, 2005). 

At first, it was used to mock the Pope in the context of pedophilia in churches and the extent of his idolization, but nowadays, it has mostly lost its negative connotation.

title: where_is_poor_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a [[politics|political]] cartoon depicting an [[obese]] man looking into a pair of [[binoculars]] while asking "Where are the poor?" His large stomach blocks his view of a starving man below him. The edit that popularized the political cartoon as a meme changed to the text to state "Where is poor?"

On March 3rd, 2025, "Twitter user @lilchiikawa_":https://twitter.com/lilchiikawa_/status/1896693852435886433 posted a redrawn version of the meme featuring the characters [[Chiikawa_(Character)|]] and [[Usagi_(Chiikawa)|]] from the series [[Chiikawa]]. This version of the meme went viral, causing several artworks inspired by it to be made. Though in this version, the second, smaller character is often being covered by [[gigantic breasts]] of the first character instead.

h4. Examples
* !asset #25240483: Original political cartoon
* !asset #25240484: Popularized meme edit
* !asset #25240486: [[Chiikawa]] version

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Where Is Poor":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/where-is-poor

title: hk416_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K HK416]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|grey]], [[aqua hair|aqua]], or [[white hair]], [[green eyes]], and wears a black [[beret]], [[military jacket]], [[plaid skirt]], and [[black thighhighs]].

Based on her in-game lines she seems to hold her skills as a soldier in high regard and strives to outperform the AR Team, especially [[M16A1 (girls' frontline)|]]. She also shows some [[yandere]] qualities towards the [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]].

A member of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]] along with [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]], [[UMP9 (girls' frontline)|]] and [[G11 (girls' frontline)|]]. Would receive a [[HK416 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], she appears as [[Clukay (neural cloud)|]]. In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], she appears as [[Klukai (girls' frontline 2)|]].

Voiced by [[Nonaka Ai]]. Illustrated by [[Gyaku Tsubasa]], though for Herbal-Flavored Hard Candy and Percussion Bolero, she was illustrated by [[Starshadowmagician]] and [[han-0v0]] respectively.

title: psd_available
body:
For when an artist has a Photoshop Document (PSD) available at their website.  These documents are not uploadable to Danbooru, so add this tag whenever one is found.  

For any questions about the following, ask in topic #14081.

h4. Source the image post, link to the PSD otherwise

h5. Both PSD and image are available separately

* Upload the image
* Set the source on Danbooru for the image (image or post link)
* Add a comment with a link on where to get the PSD

[b]Example:[/b] post #3667430

h5. Only PSD is available

* Convert the image to a usable image format, preferably PNG, and "upload it":/uploads/new.
** Converted files should be in a lossless format like PNG unless it can't go under the 100 MB filesize limit even with optimization
* Set the source on Danbooru for the PSD (file or post link).

[b]Example:[/b] post #2662037, post #2662040

title: warrior
body:
Someone engaged in or experienced in [[war]]fare and fighting. Often clad in bits of armor and drawn with a melee [[weapon]], typically [[huge weapon|heavy]] [[sword]] or large [[axe]]. Can also be applied to a Character Class in various different [[tag group:Role-playing games|RPG]] series.

While the definition is similar to "[[soldier]]", the "warrior" tag should be applied to characters with a less "professional" appearance (i.e. no uniforms), and restricted to ancient or [[medieval]] era combatants.

h4. See also
* [[Amazon warrior]]
* [[Gladiator]]
* [[Knight]]

title: ilulu_(maidragon)
body:
A Chaos faction dragon from [[Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon]] that wanted to destroy Tokyo and was defeated by [[Tohru (maidragon)|]] with the assistance of [[Elma (maidragon)|]]. Was befriended by [[Kobayashi (maidragon)|]], lives with her like [[Tohru (maidragon)|]] and [[Kanna Kamui]] and seems to be attracted to her just like Tohru.

Noted for her [[huge breasts]] (often upsized to [[gigantic breasts|gigantic]] in fanart), particularly [[oppai loli|on her petite frame]], stemming from her incomplete mastery of assuming a human form.

Previously an manga-exclusive character, she later made her anime debut on the 2nd season of Maidragon in 2021.
other_names: イルル(小林さんちのメイドラゴン)

title: fate/extra_last_encore
body: An anime series based on the [[Fate/EXTRA]] game. It was directed by Yukihiro Miyamoto and Akiyuki Shinbo and animated by ShaftWP, it was broadcasted from January 28, 2018 to April 01, 2018 on Netflix Japan. The series ran for 10 episodes and later more 3 for Illustrias Tendousetsu, that was released on July 29, 2018. Kinoko Nasu wrote the scripts, Hiroki Yamamura and Masaaki Takiyama designed the characters, and Satoru Kousaki composed the music. The series were released on June 30, 2018 worldwide on Netflix.
other_names: フェイト/エクストララストアンコール

title: gyaru_makeup
body:
The style of eye [[makeup]] traditionally associated with [[gyaru]], featuring exaggerated eyelashes, light-colored [[eyeshadow]] around the eye, and dark eyeliner. Often accentuates the [[aegyo sal]] or waterline of the eye, and can sometimes create a "droopy" look.

In real-life gyaru culture, the makeup is usually considered the most important element of the style. However, anime art is often simplified, either excluding makeup entirely or instead opting for much simpler makeup.

title: freikorps
body:
In the aftermath of World War I and during the German Revolution of 1918–19, Freikorps, consisting partially of World War I veterans, were raised as paramilitary militias. They were ostensibly mustered to fight on behalf of the government against the German communists attempting to overthrow the Weimar Republic. However, many Freikorps also largely despised the Republic and were involved in assassinations of its supporters, later aiding the [[Nazi|NSDAP]] in it’s rise to power.

Modern German historians agree that men of the Freikorps consistently embodied post-Enlightenment masculine ideals that are characterized by "physical, emotional, and moral 'hardness'". Men in the Freikorps radicalized Western and German norms of male self-control into a perpetual war against feminine-coded desires for domesticity, tenderness, and compassion amongst men. The Freikorps' displays of violence, terror, and male aggression and solidarity established the beginnings of the fascist New Man upon which the Nazis built.

title: gogeta
body:
The [[fusion|fused]] form of [[Son Goku|Goku]] and [[Vegeta]] after performing the [[Fusion Dance]] properly. Originally an anime-only character that never appeared in the manga, appearing only in [[Dragon Ball Z]] Movie 12, [i]Fusion Reborn[/i], in the [[Super Saiyan]] form, and in the [[Dragon Ball GT]] anime, in the [[Super Saiyan 4]] form.

Finally appeared in canon form with the release of Movie 20, [i][[dragon_ball_super_broly|Dragon Ball Super: Broly]][/i], in base, Super Saiyan, and [[Super Saiyan Blue]] forms. In contrast to his previous appearances, the colored bits of his Metamoran vest are in yellow rather than orange, akin to what had previously been established with [[Gotenks]]. 

His [[potara earrings|Potara Earring]] fusion counterpart is [[vegetto|Vegito]]. Has two failed Fusion Dance counterparts, a fat one named [[Veku]] and an unnamed skinny one that appeared in Movie 20.
other_names: ゴジータ(ドラゴンボール超)

title: onee_gyaru
body:
A more sophisticated and mature substyle of [[gyaru]], which tones down the wilder elements. The typical gyaru makeup and [[leopard print]] remain common aspects, but black is a more common color, leather is often worn, and overall the look is more office-friendly with simpler clothes.

It also takes a lot from high [[fashion]] and luxury brands.

title: mint_fantome
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] who is a [[ghost]] [[maid]].

Her initial streaming run was from July 2020 to April 2021; after a hiatus of exactly 3 years, she returned to streaming in April 2024. Originally illustrated by [[kgr]], on Halloween 2024, she debuted her new model (dubbed 3.0) illustrated by [[Ayamy]] and rigged by [[Cillia]], which largely resembles her previous 2.0 model (albeit with a style change due to her new illustrator).

She has [[short hair]] with a [[white hair|white]]-[[green hair|green]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[wavy hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her current default hairstyle consists of a [[two side up]] held with small blue bows and decorated with a [[triangular headpiece]], a [[maid headdress]] and an [[x hair ornament|x-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. She received [[pointy ears]] with her 3.0 model.

When streaming with [[Dokibird (VTuber)|]], [[Laimu (VTuber)|]], and [[Snuffy (VTuber)|]], they are known as the "Sloppy Sisters."

title: rolleiflex
body: A brand name used for high-end German film cameras since 1929, most notably a series of distinctive twin-lens reflex (TLR) cameras.

title: twin-lens_reflex_camera
body:
A twin-lens reflex camera (TLR) is a type of [[camera]] with two objective lenses of the same focal length. One of the lenses is used to take the picture, while the other is used for the viewfinder system, which is usually viewed from above at waist level.

The best-known TLRs are those made under the [[Rolleiflex]] brand name by the German company Franke & Heidecke, later renamed Rollei, although the Rolleiflex brand was used for non-TLR cameras as well.

h4. See also

* [[Single-lens Reflex Camera]] (SLR)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Twin-lens reflex camera":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twin-lens_reflex_camera]

title: zenra
body:
A fetish in which [[public nudity]] and sexual acts that otherwise would be considered [[public indecency]] is treated as a normal everyday activity.

"Zenra" is a Japanese word, literally translated as "[[completely nude]]". Zenra fetish features people (usually women) participating in everyday tasks that they might otherwise perform clothed, such as casual scenes with participants playing in an all-nude orchestra in a seemingly oblivious state of mind towards their nudity.

Others incorporate the nudity on a more conscious level by doing such things as playing "[[strip game|strip volleyball]]", where the participants must remove clothing each time the other team scores a point. While in some case [[sex]] and sexual acts were treated as a normal recreational activity in the setting, including in public places.

While very similar to [[exhibitionism]] and [[nudist|nudism]] in concept and often overlaps with each other, zenra fetish can be distinguished by how the setting treated nudity and sexual activity, as zenra fetish treats nudity either as a social norm at best and a minor inconvenience at worst. In addition, some zenra works also further emphasize sexual elements of the character (such as character exposing their private parts) as another form of beauty standard.

Please note that [[bathing]] or tanning on the beach are not zenra as that is normally done naked. In addition, since the word is used as a Pixiv tag for a [[completely nude]] character, only apply "zenra" tag if the setting is applicable.

h6. As a rule of thumb:
* If the person in nude is aware of their nudity and is not in the act that requires them to be in nude (such as [[bathing]]) but does not attempt to cover it and acts as normal, then the tag "[[nudist]]" is applicable.
* If the person in nude is in public place, being in presence with other people, or is overtly showing their state of nudity to others, then the tag "[[exhibitionism]]" is applicable.
* If the setting of the image treats the state of nudity or sexual act as a normal activity, then the tag "zenra" is applicable.

h4. See also

* [[change in common sense]]
* [[exhibitionism]]
* [[naked school attendance]]
* [[nudist]]
* [[sex battle]]
* pool #1536: Casual Nudity

title: oshi-katsu
body:
The act of stans supporting their favorite [[idol]] or character. A form of [[otaku]] activities (ota-katsu), seen commonly among high school girls and young women. They can be distinguished from standard otaku as their nerdiness is centered on a single individual.

The word is used for someone being extremely dedicated to supporting their favorite - the object of their affection is their "oshi". (while "katsu" is short for [i]katsudou[/i] - activities)

Most commonly shown through having tons of merchandise of a single idol or character, or through typical idol fan behavior. [[Jirai kei]] girls frequently practice oshi-katsu.

h4. Examples

* !post #7343594: A [[jirai kei]] girl with an [[itabag]]
* !post #8305371: Fans cheering on an idol
* !post #7171652: Room decor based on one's oshi
* !post #5370485: Showing off merchandise

title: black_tide_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after the Kuroshio current, "Black Tide" being a literal translation of "Kuroshio".[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Wind in Her Hair, he is [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]]'s full elder brother. While he only has a single G2 victory (The 2004 Spring Stakes), he went to stud thanks to Deep Impact's exploits implying he might have a chance there. Indeed, Black Tide managed to sire one of Japan's greatest racehorses with [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]].

title: daring_tact_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. Japan's sixth Triple Tiara and the very first to be unveiled in [i]Umamusume[/i].

With the 4th anniversary, she is revealed to be the nature uma, running for the sake of her hometown. As an aficionado of hiking in the wilds and mountain climbing (and thanks to certain bear-related incidents [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|her RL counterpart]] or [[Titleholder (racehorse)|other inferred natives of her hometown]] took part in or witnessed), many recent artworks present her as a wilderness survival expert and/or as someone who fights [[bear]]s at a regular basis.

She is currently the youngest horse represented in the franchise (born April 15th 2017), (at the time, replacing [[Satono Diamond (umamusume)|]], who was born January 30th 2013, in that spot) and the first horse to be still active when first unveiled.

She would appear in Season 3 of the anime, appearing along with Team Rigel, presumably their newest recruit. She later made a cameo appearance in [[Mejiro Ramonu (umamusume)|]]'s campaign. It's only with the 4th anniversary update that she obtained a speaking role.

As for her relationship with other characters, she is noted to be particularly deep in "the Dark Side of the Horse":[/pools/17253], being the RL descendant of 5 characters, several of those being important in the main stories.

Voiced by [[Youmiya Hina]].

h4. Appearance

title: a_shuai_on_line
body: 阿衰on line, aka a shuai on line, is a popular Chinese bcomic and animated series centered around the misadventures of its titular character, A Shuai (阿衰), a cheeky, unlucky, and socially awkward middle school student. Known for its slapstick humor and relatable school-life scenarios, the series humorously explores themes like friendship, teenage struggles, and the chaos of growing up. Originally a long-running comic by cartoonist Mao Xiaole (猫小乐), it gained a massive following in China and was adapted into an animated series, amplifying its appeal through exaggerated gags and A Shuai’s endearing underdog persona.

title: silver_the_hedgehog
body:
A [[Sonic (series)|]] character.

A psychic hedgehog from a dystopian future. Silver is a time traveler with a mission to right the wrongs of the past to ensure that his future is saved from catastrophe. Silver's ability is Psychokinesis, which allows him to manipulate objects with his mind. In [[Sonic the Hedgehog (2006)]], he and [[Blaze the Cat]] are companions, working together to find the true identity of the [[Iblis (sonic)|]] Trigger, the one responsible for the destruction of their time. He is ostensibly inspired by [[Trunks (future) (dragon ball)|Trunks]] from the [i][[Dragon Ball Z]][/i] series, being that they are both time travelers trying to save their future from certain destruction.

His voice actors are Pete Capella (2006-2010), Quinton Flynn (2010-2017) and Bryce Papenbrook (2019).

His seiyuu is [[Ono Daisuke]].

h4. See Also

* [[Super Silver]]

title: gundam_msv
body:
The [b]Mobile Suit Variations[/b], simply known as [b]MSV[/b] to fans, are variations on the mechanical designs of the [[Gundam]] franchise, particularly those of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. Most of them never appeared in animated form. They were first published in 1983.

These [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]] variations are official designs, including their own histories and in many cases their own pilots with detailed backstories. Some were cancelled or alternative designs originally created for an animated production, while others are promotional variations used as the basis for unique [[gunpla|model kits]]. 

While never seen in their own animation series, most of the MSV machines (as well as the backstories and pilots created for them) are considered canonical, and a feature in other side-stories, manga, or (mostly) in [[video game]]s.

title: uchuu_senkan_yamato
body:
[b]Uchuu Senkan Yamato[/b] (Space Battleship Yamato) is a legendary and classic Japanese [[science fiction]] anime series. It was created by [[Matsumoto Leiji]] and Nishizaki Yoshinobu in the early 1970s. 

The first TV anime series aired on Yomiuri TV in October 6, 1974 and was followed by several animated movie sequels and two more TV series seasons (broadcast in 1978 and 1980 respectively). 

It is notable because it was one of the first military science fiction anime that depicted space battleships and cosmic [[battle]]s among fleets of spaceships. Its creators were also inspired by [[Star Trek]] when the series was being developed. 

Uchuu Senkan Yamato influenced several later sci-fi anime like [[Gundam]], [[Macross]], [[Top wo Nerae!]] (Gunbuster) and [[Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu]] (Legend of the Galactic Heroes) among others. It also influenced various productions in the west, like [[Star Wars]] and [[Battlestar Galactica]] (both the original and re-imagined versions).

It is known to English-speaking audiences as [b]Space Battleship Yamato[/b] and also as [b]Star Blazers[/b]. In Spanish and Latin American countries it was called [b]Astronave Intrepido[/b] ("Starship Intrepid"). In European and Asian countries it was also called [b]Estrellas Luminosas[/b] ("Luminous Stars"), [b]Cosmoship Yamato[/b], [b]Anti-Space Ship[/b], [b]Journey to the Final Galaxy[/b] and [b]Star Patrol[/b]. 

Its last anime film sequel to the original series was released on December 2009 and a live action film adaptation of the first TV series was released on December 2010 in Japan. 

A new reboot series based on the first season called [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] was released in 2012. A  series sequel to 2199 called [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2202: Ai no Senshi-Tachi]] was released in 2018. 

The latest animated film series (sequel to 2202) were released in 2021 with the name [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2205: Arata Naru Tabidachi]].

title: mori_yuki
body:
[b]Mori Yuki[/b] is one of the main characters from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] science fiction anime series from the 70s. She also appears in the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] remake from 2012.

Yuki is a Japanese female crew member who has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair|brown]] or [[blonde hair]] and is generally seen wearing a [[bodysuit]].

She looks identical to [[Starsha]]. (In the remake series, she was made nearly identical to [[Yurisha Iscandar]], only with mirrored direction of bangs and darker hair color.)

Her original design was created by [[Matsumoto Leiji]] in the 70s, and is very similar to many other of his female character creations such as [[Maetel]].

Yuki's name in the Star Blazers western adaptation was changed to [b]Nova Forrester[/b] and her ethnicity to American.

Voiced by [[Kuwashima Houko]] in the remake series from 2012.

title: tachie_(fate)
body:
A heroine of [[Fate/stay night]] introduced in Fate/unpublished material and Shielder-class Servant of Ernest Gravehill.

Known as the Stray Servant (はぐれ サーヴァント), she was a heroine candidate during the development of [[Fate/stay night]] who was left unused in the final version. She was considered along with [[medusa_(fate)|Rider]] and [[medea (caster) (fate)|Caster]] to be a possible heroine, but she was cut due to the plot beginning to stray so as to keep it manageable for the player. As [[artoria_pendragon_(fate)|Saber]] is a "Servant of the Sword", she was to be her rival as a Shielder, "Servant of the Shield."

The design was later revived for [[Fate/Grand Order]] in 2015 for Kinoko Nasu to allow her to be one of the main heroines along with [[artoria_pendragon_(fate)|Saber]] and [[jeanne_d'arc_(fate)|Ruler]], thus becoming [[Mash Kyrielight]].

title: class_card_(prisma_illya)
body:
Magical artifacts created to allow for the summoning of heroic spirits similar to Servants that instead allows the user to borrow their powers & abilities. They serve as a major plot point in [[Fate/kaleid liner Prisma Illya]].

They have two main functions, [b]Include[/b] and [b]Install[/b]. Inclusion allows for the wielder to materialize a weapon or Noble Phantasm belonging to the heroic spirit, while installing manifests the servant directly into the user's body, including their [[cosplay|appearance]].

The cards can also manifest independently as blackened Servants, acting as weaker versions of their own selves.

h4. Known Cards & Users
* [[Artoria Pendragon (Fate)|Saber]]: [[Zachary Ainsworth]], [[Miyu Edelfelt (Saber Install)|]], [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Saber Install)|]]

title: salem_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Pseudo-Singularity IV: The Forbidden Advent Garden, Salem[/b]
[quote]
It happened suddenly...without warning.

It snuffed out all the light in the land, and it enveloped an entire town under the cover of night. Such a phenomenon could only be described as...darkness. The enormous, malicious magical energy emanating from within the darkness bears a strong resemblance to the shadow of one of the Demon Gods who attempted the Incineration of Humanity.

What will become of this heretical land when the causes of this evil are eradicated?
[/quote]
The fourth pseudo-singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the town of Salem in the year 1692 during the Salem witch trials. After the events of the [[Solomon (singularity) (fate/grand order)|Solomon singularity]], several [[demon pillar (fate)|]]s escaped and created subcategory singularities, resulting in the creation of Salem (among others). [spoiler]The demon pillar [[Raum (fate)|]] created a recreation of historical Salem and [[Abigail Williams (fate)|]], placing them in a time loop where he kept reiterating the same events in an attempt to summon the outer god Sut-Typhon.[/spoiler]

Released on the Japanese server on November 29, 2017 and on the NA server on December 2, 2019. It was adapted into a manga by [[Oomori Aoi]].

Upon release of Salem (and the other pseudo-singularities), the true name of several new servants was initially hidden; however official Fate/Grand Order media would later forego keeping their true names hidden in promotional materials. Their aliases are listed below, but their true names are used on Danbooru for tagging.

title: vergo
body:
[[One Piece]] character. A Marine vice-admiral and head of G-5, "Demon Bamboo" Vergo is actually a member of the [[donquixote_family|Donquixote Pirates]].

A [[haki (one piece)|]] master that's prone to getting food and eating utensils stuck to his face.

[spoiler]Presumed dead after the Punk Hazard incident.[/spoiler]

title: gear_fourth
body:
One of [[Monkey D. Luffy]]'s transformations from [[One Piece]].

Luffy coats his arm in [[Haki (one piece)|]] before biting into his forearm. Similar to how he activates [[Gear Third]], he blows an incredible amount of air into his body, but this time he inflates his muscular structure before distributing the air throughout his body, with emphasis on his upper half. If Luffy is stopped mid-blowing, the arm will slowly deflate.

When utilizing [[Gear Fourth]], Luffy makes extensive usage of his [[Haki (one piece)|]] by coating his arms, legs and much of his torso in it to the point that they turn black from hardening. The Haki coating across his body resembles the wispy ends made from flames, giving it the appearance of tattoos, and he gains shading around the inner and outer edges of his eyes. He also physically grows taller, standing around 4 meters tall. Similar to when using [[Gear Second]], Luffy is continuously emitting steam in this form. Combined with Luffy's rubbery composition and his compressed muscle structure, [[Gear Fourth]] both adds explosive power to Luffy's attacks and grants him enhanced defensive capabilities far beyond what he can demonstrate with or without [[Gear Second]] or [[Gear Third]]. Depending on the situation, Luffy can adapt [[Gear Fourth]] into different forms.



* [[Gear Fourth: Boundman|Boundman]]
* [[Gear Fourth: Snakeman|Snakeman]]
* [[Gear Fourth: Tankman|Tankman]]

title: gear_fourth:_snakeman
body:
One of the forms of [[Gear Fourth]] used by [[Monkey D. Luffy]].

Unlike his other two [[gear fourth|Gear 4]] forms, Luffy does not significantly expand, with his forearms, legs, and upper torso being only slightly enlarged and the rest of his body retaining its normal proportions. The spread of [[Haki (one piece)|]] is slightly more limited, as it does not appear to extend onto Luffy's shoulders and upper body. However, Luffy's hair becomes flame-shaped like his [[Haki (one piece)|]] and sticks up. Instead of steam, this form produces a gaseous substance appearing as a mix of steam and fire and like its other counterparts also seems to be draped over his shoulders like a scarf while in this form. His fists also flex differently, with the first knuckles being extended, similar to leopard fist.

title: gear_fourth:_boundman
body:
One of the forms of [[Gear Fourth]] used by [[Monkey D. Luffy]].

Luffy's proportions become warped, and his body becomes much larger in size, with his arms, upper torso, and legs coated in [[Haki (one piece)|Busoshoku Haki]]. As a side-effect, he is incapable of standing still on the ground, and instead constantly bounds on the spot. This form was created in order to combat the many powerful and large animals on Rusukaina.

http://onepiece.wikia.com/wiki/Zephyr

title: haki_(one_piece)
body:
[b]Haki[/b] (lit. "ambition, aspiration") is a special technique found in the world of [[One Piece]].

Haki is a type of spiritual energy that allows the user to perform various superhuman feats by harnessing their willpower. As Haki is directly tied to one's psyche, in theory everyone is capable of accessing it. However, unlocking the use of Haki can be prove very difficult for those who are not aware of it.

h5. Types of Haki
* [b]Observation Haki:[/b] Allows the users to read their opponents' movements and detect the presence of others.
* [b]Armament Haki:[/b] Grants protection, increased offense and counters certain [[Devil Fruit]] abilities (mostly Logia types). Appears as a black coating on the body and weapons wielded by the user.
* [b]Supreme King Haki:[/b] The rarest type of Haki that only few "chosen ones" possesses. Allows the user to enforce their will on weaker opponents, rendering them unconscious. In addition, an experienced user of Supreme King Haki can infuse it into their weapon or attacks, thus significantly increasing their power.

This tag is applicable when the usage of or a manifestation of Haki is present. Typically, an aura of Haki can be identified by a black-and-red [[lightning]] around the user.

h5. Examples
* !post #8081385: Typical Haki lightning aura
* !post #8438305: Armament Haki-infused punch

title: broom_(the_sorcerer's_apprentice)
body:
Inanimate brooms brought to life due to an enchantment cast by an apprentice of magic. The depiction they came to be known by worldwide was fully created by Disney[1], appearing in the animated movie [[Fantasia (disney)|]]. 

If broken, each splinter will turn into a new, complete broom, behaving in the same way as the original.

In [[Fantasia (disney)|]], the broom uses its bristles to walk around as if they were feet. 

[i][1] citation needed[/i]

h4. See also
* [[The Sorcerer's Apprentice]]
* [[Fantasia (disney)|]]

The most popular segment is [[The Sorcerer's Apprentice]], based on the poem, featuring [[Mickey Mouse]], [[Yen Sid]], and a [[broom (the sorcerer's apprentice)|]]. It was the only segment featured in both 1940 and 2000.

title: dowadge
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]].

[b]MS-09G Dowadge[/b]

Another variant of the [[dom_(mobile_suit)|MS-09B Dom]], its relationship with the MS-10 [[Pezun Dwadge]] is uncertain. 

It is the final production model of the Dom series. It featured head mounted vulcan guns and external propellant tanks, extending its hover ability. In addition, the rear thermonuclear jet propulsion unit features dust filters and is equipped with a back-mounted antenna to increase communication capabilities. 

In addition to the heat saber used by most Doms models, the Dwadge can also use a [[heat hawk]]. The Dwadge also used a slightly larger (380mm) version of the giant bazooka which uses shaped charge ammunition.
