title: den'an_gei
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam F91]] anime film from 1991.

[b]XM-02 Den'an Gei[/b]

A [[Crossbone Vanguard]] [[mobile suit]] designed for guerrilla warfare. It did not carry the Vanguard's trademark [[shot lancer]] weapon, instead being armed with vulcan guns, a small arm [[beam cannon]], a grenade rack, a beam saber, and a [[beam rifle]] for more well-rounded firepower. 

This array of weapons made the Den'an Gei more well-suited to hit-and-run strike type missions.

title: first_indochina_war
body:
The [b]First Indochina War[/b] was a war lasting from 1945 to 1954, between communist-backed Indochinese Independence fighters and the nation of [[France]], which was attempting to regain the control of their colonies.

The war ended after the both sides agreed to a compromise agreement backed by the [[United States]], to release the countries of [[Laos]] and [[Cambodia]] and split the country of [[Vietnam]] into the communist North and democratic (albeit later dictatorial) South, with the goal of holding a popular referendum on unifying Vietnam later on. The failure to hold this referendum and tensions between both sides led to the outbreak of the [[Vietnam War|Second Indochina War]] in 1960.

h4. See Also
* [[battle of dien bien phu|Battle of Điện Biên Phủ]]
* [[tag_group:history]]
other_names: 第一次インドシナ戦争

MEIKO is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed by the YAMAHA Corporation and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the first VOCALOID engine. She was later adopted by Crypton as an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and wears a red [[miniskirt]], [[crop top]], and [[boots]]. She is often seen with a [[microphone stand]], and is also frequently seen drinking from One Cup Ozeki, a [[sake]] widely available through vending machines.

She is voiced by singer [[Haigo Meiko]]. Her first appearance was illustrated by [[Wasshi (wassy_m)|]], with her [[Meiko (Vocaloid3)|second appearance]] for VOCALOID3 illustrated by [[iXima]].

title: kachina_doll
body:
Kachina Dolls are gifts given in hope of future abundance and health. The Kachina Dolls of today's art market are a bridge not only between the spiritual world and mortals but also between Hopis and non-Hopis.
Kachinas are spirits or personifications of things in the real world. These spirits are believed to visit the Hopi villages during the first half of the year. The local pantheon of kachinas varies from pueblo community to community. A kachina can represent anything in the natural world or cosmos, from a revered ancestor to an element, a location, a quality, a natural phenomenon, or a concept; there may be kachinas for the sun, stars, thunderstorms, wind, corn, insects, as well as many other concepts.

Beginning around 1900, there was a great deal of interest in the Kachina figurines, especially among tourists, and the dolls became sought-after collectibles. For this reason, many Hopi began making the figurines commercially to make a living.

title: propaganda
body:
Works or messages that strongly promote [[politics|political]], ideological or moral causes and movements.

On Danbooru, propaganda may refer to:

* Slogans promoting a cause as the center of attention and purpose of a picture.
* Slogans found on various clothing a character is wearing.
* Glorification of a particular political ideology, nation, individual, historical event, or race. Real or fictional.
* [[Satire]] and [[parody]] of the above.

Not to be mistaken for [[ad|advertising]], which is promotion of commercial products and services for the sole purpose of generating revenue, securing market share or cultural popularity.

h4. See also

* [[Ad]]
* [[Patriotism]]

h5. Tagged propaganda piece / slogan

* [[Make America Great Again]]
* [[We Can Do It!]]
* [[Yes We Can]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Propaganda]

title: fascist
body:
An ultra-[[patriotism|nationalist]] and authoritarian ideology first popularized by [[Benito Mussolini]] in [[Italy]] around the 1920s, and then by [[Adolf Hitler]] in [[Germany]] during the 1930s; German fascism is better known as [[Nazi|Nazism]].

Fascists usually promote national and (occasionally) racial supremacy over other countries, are very big believers in "social Darwinism", and seek to maintain or expand the country for the benefit of the "master race" at the other's expense.

h4. See also
* [[Nazi]]
* "Wikipedia: Fascism":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fascism]

title: battle_of_dien_bien_phu
body: The Battle of Điện Biên Phủ was a climactic confrontation of the First Indochina War that took place between 13 March and 7 May 1954. It was fought between the French Union's colonial Far East Expeditionary Corps and the Viet Minh.

title: a_better_tomorrow
body:
[i]A Better Tomorrow[/i] (Chinese: 英雄本色; literally "True Colors of a Hero") is a 1986 [[Hong Kong]] movie which started the "Heroic Bloodshed" genre of action movies in Hong Kong. The movie launched the career of Chow Yun-Fat, whose role as the Triad gangster Mark Gor defined badass, and established John Woo as one of Hong Kong's leading action directors.

Its most famous and frequently [[parody|parodied]] scene involves the protagonist Mark Gor lit his [[cigarette]] with a burning [[banknote]].

h4. See Also

* "Wikipedia: A Better Tomorrow":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Better_Tomorrow

title: spinach
body:
A type of [[vegetable]] native to central and Western Asia. Its nutritional leaves were typically eaten raw, steamed, boiled, or used as a filling.

It is most famously associated with [[Popeye]] as the food that gave him superhuman strength whenever eaten.

title: popeye
body:
The titular character of [[Popeye the Sailor]] series. He is a [[sailor]] who is almost always seen with a [[smoking pipe]] in his mouth.

He is frequently harassed by his taller arch-enemy [[Bluto]], who is normally stronger than him. However, whenever he ate a [[spinach]], he gained superhuman strength that is capable of easily defeating Bluto and other adversaries with ease.

title: boku_no_hero_academia
body:
[b]Boku no Hero Academia[/b] (僕のヒーローアカデミア [i]My Hero Academia[/i]) is a manga series by [[Horikoshi Kouhei]] that has been serialized in [[Shounen Jump]] from 2014 to 2024.

Set in a world where some people were born with "Quirk"; various types of superhuman powers, with some chose to exploit it for benevolent (as "Hero") or malevolent (as "Villain") purposes. The series follow [[Midoriya Izuku]] aka "Deku", a boy with unstable Quirk who attended the U.A. High School, a school that is specifically made for training their students into Heroes.

title: mating_press_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a screenshot of [[Ace Attorney]], in which the [[judge]] hit the [[gavel]] and declares that the verdict for the "accused" would be [[mating press]].

May also used for the quote alone as an expression to the character's sex appeal, similar to the "[[would (meme)|]]" meme.

title: mating_press
body:
A [[sex]] position similar to [[missionary]] position, but where the top person's body (usually a [[size difference|much larger]] male) obscures most if not all of the bottom's body, leaving only their legs and lower body visible, if that.

The position's name alleged that this is the most "optimal" position for reproduction purposes, and as such is often associated with primal instincts. The female equivalent is [[amazon position]].

This position be juxtaposed against a completely innocuous image of a character for comical or erotic reasons, typically in an [[instant loss]] images.

h4. See also 

* [[folded]]
* [[instant loss]]
* [[mating press (meme)]]
* [[Tag Group:Sexual Positions]]

title: amazon_position
body:
A [[girl on top|female-dominant]] [[sex]] position in which the woman rides her partner while their legs are [[folded]] back against their chest, or spread wide with their feet in the air. In either case, her partner's thighs are in front of her rather than behind. Also known as a reverse [[piledriver (sex)|]]. The name stipulated that it originated from the mythical [[Amazon warrior]] tribe, in which the position is used simply for reproduction purposes.

A skilled woman in this position can emulate the pelvic thrusting motion typical of a male partner, giving a near-complete feeling of role reversal. It is a typical position in [[femdom]] or [[BDSM]] fetish if the partner is bound or in amazon position [[rape|against their will]].

h4. See also

* [[reverse amazon position]]
* [[girl on top]]
* [[mating press]]
* [[piledriver (sex)|]]
* [[Tag group:Sexual positions]]

title: bikini_armor
body:
[[revealing clothes|Skimpy]], [[bikini]]-style [[armor]]. Usually worn by attractive female warriors to maximize exposure of body parts such as [[cleavage]], [[midriff]], [[ass|buttocks]], hips, [[legs]], etc. It is also commonly associated with the [[Amazon warrior]] trope.

The top part covering the [[breasts]] is either a bikini top or, more commonly, is usually shaped much like a bikini top but with some obvious [[metal]] reinforcement marks. The bottom may be a bikini bottom, a short [[loincloth]], a long loincloth, a [[skirt]], full [[pants]], or possibly some combination. Armored [[boots]] and [[cape]]s can be expected, along with options like [[helmet]]s, [[gauntlets]], [[elbow pads]], [[knee pads]], [[shoulder pads]], [[power suit]]s, etc. 

Naturally, and ironically, less coverage usually means less protection from attack, so one would think that bikini armor has an inherent [[magic]] to apply the inverse relationship between coverage and protection.

h4. Examples
* !post #8559449: A typical example of bikini armor ([[Warrior (dq3)|]] from [[Dragon Quest III]]).

h4. See also
* [[reverse bikini armor]] - for armor that is also lacking in coverage, but in the opposite areas compared to bikini armor.

title: warrior_(dq3)
body:
A character class in [[Dragon Quest III]]. Japanese name 戦士 (Senshi), which is often translated as warrior.

h4. Appearance
* !post #8485391: Male (left) and Female (right).

The female version has long [[purple hair]] (some fan art gave it a more natural color), usually [[blue eyes]], and wears a red [[bikini armor|bikini-style armor]] with [[shoulder pads]], [[red boots]], [[red gloves]] over dark sleeves, and a red [[helmet]] with wings and a blue or purple medallion on the forehead.

Note that her upper body garb is reminiscent of [[valkyrie_(vnd)|Valkyrie]] from [[Valkyrie no Densetsu]], while the color scheme resembles [[Princess Athena]]'s.

title: klint_van_zieks
other_names: クリムト・バンジークズ

title: iris_wilson
body:
[[The Great Ace Attorney]] character. A female parody of John Watson, [[Herlock Sholmes]]' assistant.

Iris has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] styled into elaborate look made up of [[bow-shaped hair|bow-shaped]] [[hair rings]] and [[drill hair]] [[twintails]] and [[aqua eyes]]. Iris usually wears [[goggles on head]], [[yellow bow]], a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled collar]], [[center frills]] & [[puffy sleeves|puffy]] [[frilled sleeves]] [[white shirt]] underneath her [[black dress|black]] [[strapless dress]] with a [[black belt]] and [[bubble skirt]] with [[white bloomers]] underneath. She wears [[frilled gloves|frilled]] [[brown gloves]] on her hands, a [[green bag|green]] [[backpack]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]] on her legs.

title: amazon_(dragon's_crown)
body:
A character class from [[Dragon's Crown]]. Being the prime example of the [[Amazon warrior]] trope.

She appeared as a [[blonde hair]]ed woman with [[muscular female|muscular body]] and wearing a [[bikini armor]] She wields a large [[battle axe]] as her weapon.
other_names: アマゾン(ドラゴンズクラウン)

title: amazon_warrior
body:
A mythical tribe of female [[warrior]]s in [[Greek mythology]]. In popular culture, "Amazon warriors" refers to a stereotypical depiction of female warriors, particularly those with [[muscular female|muscular build]] and wearing a skimpy [[bikini armor]].

This trope is first popularized in the west by the [[Conan (series)|Conan the Barbarian]] series before various Japanese media such as [[Queen's Blade]], [[Dragon Quest]], and [[Dragon's Crown]] embedded this trope into eastern fantasy culture.

Only apply this tag if the character is exhibiting characteristic typical of Amazon warrior trope. Do not apply this tag only because the character hail from their equivalent of Amazon tribe.

h4. See also
* [[Amazon position]] - sex position commonly associated with Amazon warrior trope

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Amazons":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazons

title: barok_van_zieks
body:
The main prosecutor in [[The Great Ace Attorney]] games.

Barok has [[short hair|short]], somewhat messy [[purple hair]], [[blue eyes|blue]]-[[grey eyes]], and a [[scar on face|scar on his face]]. He wears a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black jacket|black justacorp]] outlined with gold stripes and gold [[buttons]]. He wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] underneath, gold [[epaulettes]], a [[white sash]] with a red stripe, [[grey pants]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], a [[white ascot]] pinned on with a gold [[crest]], [[white gloves]], and Klint's prosecutor's [[badge]]. Occasionally, he wears a [[black cape]] he takes off when he gets serious. He carries a [[sword]] with him at all times worn on his right side, suggesting he's left handed.
other_names: バロック・バンジークス

title: herlock_sholmes
body:
Ersatz name for Sherlock Holmes, made-up in 1907 by Maurice Leblanc to avoid getting sued by Arthur Conan Doyle for using his character.

On Danbooru, it refers to [[The Great Ace Attorney]] character, the famous [[detective]] who works alongside [[Ryunosuke Naruhodo]].

Sholmes has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. 

Sholmes typically wears a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[deerstalker]] with [[goggles on headwear|goggles on it]], a [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[neck ribbon]], [[brown coat]] alongside a [[brown belt]] with three [[flask]]s strapped to it, [[brown gloves|brown]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[grey pants]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. He wears a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[collared shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and a [[vest]] over it underneath his coat.
He is often depicted holding a [[smoking pipe]].
other_names: シャーロック・ホームズ(大逆転裁判)

title: okayama_shinako
body: Key animator, animation director.

title: akuma_(d.gray-man)
body:
Akuma are the monstrous creatures that exist in the D.Gray-Man series. They are created by the [[Millennium Earl]], the main antagonist of the series, and serve and take orders from him and the Clan Of Noah. They are dangerous monsters who have no other purpose but to attack and kill humans and the more humans they kill the more powerful they become.

An Akuma in the D.Gray-Man universe is created through tragedy: when someone loses a loved one, and they are in mourning, the Millennium Earl appears before them and grants their wish of bringing their loved one back by summoning the souls of those who died inside a skeleton machine, however the souls are in pain and suffering after this ordeal, and, under the Millennium Earl's orders, they attack and kill the loved one that asked for their resurrection and wear their body like a skin. The combination of soul trapped in the skeleton machine and wearing the body of a human makes an Akuma.

Akumas can also evolve by killing humans. And as of right now, they have 4 stages of evolution which they can achieve the more humans they kill.

It's the job of an Exorcist in this series to hunt down and destroy Akuma so that they may stop an Akuma from causing more carnage and also bring salvation to the soul inside an Akuma.

title: draw_this_in_your_style_challenge
body:
A type of artwork challenge in which an artist will post a piece and invite their followers to [[derivative work|redraw it in their own styles]]. Commonly known as DTIYS for short, and particularly popular on Instagram more than on other platforms.

This tag can be used for both the original artwork and response pieces. If both the original and responses are posted for a particular DTIYS, the original version should be set as a parent post for the response images.

title: black_order_uniform
body: Uniform worn by Exorcists of the Black Order in the D.Gray-Man series. It typically consists of a long, black coat with white lines and markings on it along with a Cross emblem on its chest which is the symbol of the Black Order. Later versions of the uniform however, adopt a more militarized look, looking more like uniform worn by soldiers, the white lines and markings are replaced with red ones, and the Cross emblem also looks more like a badge with a Cross on it.

title: chokeposting_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] parodying a scene from [[The Last of Us 2]] in which [[Ellie (the last of us)|]] is choked by [[Abby (the last of us)|]]. A screenshot from this scene was leaked before the game's release, which led to many parodies of this scene featuring different characters.

h4. See Also
* [[abby buttsex (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Original screenshot":[https://knowyourmeme.com/photos/1848216-abby-choke-edits]
* "Know Your Meme: Abby Choke Edits":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/abby-choke-edits]

title: abby_buttsex_(meme)
body:
Abby Buttsex refers to a series of memes in which characters from various franchises are edited as if they are having sex from behind, with the format based on a leaked scene of The Last of Us Part II character [[abby_(the_last_of_us)|Abby]] engaging in intercourse. 

h4. Gallery
* !asset #25229517: First Template
* !asset #25229519: Second Template
* !asset #25229515: Examples

h4. See Also
* [[Chokeposting (meme)]]
* [[The Last of Us]]
* [[The Last of Us 2]]

h4. External Links
* "KnowYourMeme: Abby Buttsex Edits":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/abby-buttsex-edits]
* "YouTube: TLOU2 v animated TAKE ON ME":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CCThsn8DySA]

title: rino_(princess_connect!)
body:
A [[Princess Connect!]] character and a member of the guild Labyrinth. She also appears in the remake, Princess Connect! Re:Dive, as [[yuuki (princess connect!)|Yuuki]]'s younger sister.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair rings]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[red capelet]], [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], [[cross-laced_top|cross-laced]] [[pink shirt|pink]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts|bike]] [[short shorts]] [[shorts under skirt|under her skirt]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]].

h4. Official Costumes/Variants:
* !asset #20024916: Default
* !asset #20166623: [[rino_(wonderland)_(princess_connect!)|Wonderland Rino]]
* !asset #20166626: [[rino_(christmas)_(princess_connect!)|Christmas Rino]]
* !asset #20166631: [[rino_(valentines)_(princess_connect!)|Valentines Rino]]

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[rino_(real)_(princess_connect!)|Inosaki Rino]] (衣之咲 璃乃).[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Asumi Kana]].

h4. External Links

* "Princess Connect Re:Dive Wiki: Rino":https://princess-connect.fandom.com/wiki/Rino
* "Shadowverse Wiki: Rino, Cleansweep Archer":https://shadowverse.fandom.com/wiki/Rino,_Cleansweep_Archer

title: total_nonstop_action_wrestling
body:
Professional [[wrestling]] promotion, commonly known by their acronym [b]TNA[/b]. 

Established in 2002 as [b]NWA: Total Nonstop Action (NWA-TNA)[/b], first went by their current name from 2004 to 2017, briefly known as [b]Global Force Wrestling[/b] in 2017 and went by [b]Impact Wrestling[/b] from 2017 to 2024 before reverting back to the TNA name.

h4. See also

* "List of professional wrestlers (TNA)":[/wiki_pages/list_of_professional_wrestlers#dtext-tna]

title: consejo_mundial_de_lucha_libre
body:
Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) is a Mexican professional [[wrestling]] company founded in [[Mexico City]] with Luchas scheduled in [[Guadalajara]], [[State of Puebla|Puebla]], and elsewhere in central and southern [[Mexico]]. The promoter is also called by its previous name Empresa Mexicana de la Lucha Libre (EMLL). It is currently the oldest professional wrestling promoter in Mexico and the world that is still in existence.

h4. See also

* "List of professional wrestlers (CMLL)":[/wiki_pages/list_of_professional_wrestlers#dtext-cmll]

title: all_elite_wrestling
body:
Also known as [b]AEW[/b], it is an American wresting company founded in 2019 by American businessman Tony Khan, who is also the co-owner along with his father, Shahid Khan. 

h4. See also

* "List of professional wrestlers (AEW)":[/wiki_pages/list_of_professional_wrestlers#dtext-aew]

title: wwe
body:
The biggest professional [[wrestling]] company in the world. 

The name is an acronym for [b]World Wrestling Entertainment[/b]; the company was previously known as the [b]World Wrestling Federation[/b] ([b]WWF[/b]) from 1979 to 2002.  The company was founded as the [b]World Wide Wrestling Federation[/b] ([b]WWWF[/b]) in 1963.

h4. See also

title: oumae_kumiko
body:
Oumae Kumiko is the protagonist of [[Hibike! Euphonium]]. She plays the [[euphonium]] in the Kitauji High School concert band. She develops close relationships with other band members, especially [[Kousaka Reina]], [[Katou Hazuki]], [[Kawashima Sapphire]], [[Tanaka Asuka]], and [[Nakagawa Natsuki]]. [[Tsukamoto Shuuichi]] is her childhood friend.

Kumiko has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], which is often described as [[curly hair|curly]] or "fluffy". She has [[brown eyes]].

title: ro635_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Colt 9mm SMG|RO635]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

The final member of the [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]]-led [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]], appearing after circumstances prevent M4 from leading the team for a time. Would receive a [[RO635 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], RO appears as [[Robella (girls' frontline 2)|]]. She is voiced by [[Fukuhara Ayaka]].

title: ueiku_hana
body:
A character in [[Seishun Kirameki Rockers!!]]. She plays the [[keyboard (instrument)|]].
Her surname is most likely a reference to English keyboard player Rick [b]Wake[/b]man, known for his involvement in Yes.

title: ahegao
body:
Ahegao (アヘ顔, lit. "ahe face", where "ahe" is a sound effect for wild moaning) is a facial expression where the [[rolling eyes|eyes are rolled up]], the [[open mouth|mouth is open]], and the [[tongue out|tongue is sticking out]]. Frequently accompanied by [[blush|blushing]], [[drooling]], [[sweat|sweating]], raising the eyebrows, or a [[double V]] gesture.

This expression usually (but not always) indicates a state of exaggerated sexual pleasure. It can also indicate [[crazy|craziness]], [[drugged|drug influence]], or [[asphyxiation]].

Not to be confused with [[torogao]], which is an expression that usually indicates a state of trance-like pleasure. Ahegao is a more wild expression.

h4. Examples

* !post #4241364
* !post #892003

h4. Variants

* [[ahegaokin]]
* [[super masara ahegao]]

h4. See also

* [[bohegao]]
* [[fucked silly]]
* [[torogao]]
* [[Tag Group:Face Tags]]

title: shakugan_no_shana
body:
[b]Shakugan no Shana[/b] (灼眼のシャナ, lit. "Shana of the Burning Eyes") is a 2002-2011 light novel series written by Takahashi Yashichiro and illustrated by [[Ito Noizi]], with an ongoing 2005 manga adaptation illustrated by [[Sasakura Ayato]] and a three-season anime adaptation by [[J.C. Staff]] in 2005, 2007 and 2011.

[[Sakai Yuuji]]'s ordinary life changes forever when he witnesses time stopping around him and a monster being slain by [[Shana]], a red-haired petite swordsman, who proclaims that he is dead all along and is but a mere "Torch" - a specter of his former self bound to vanish any time soon. Yet through a mysterious power Yuuji is able to retain his existence, and thus he joins Shana and her faction, the Flame Hazes, in their long-standing struggle against the Denizens of the Crimson Realm, who are intent to use his powers to disrupt the balance of the world.

* [[Misaki High School uniform]]

title: miquella_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Miquella[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is the [[twins|twin]] [[brother and sister|brother]] and lord of [[Malenia Blade of Miquella|Malenia]], and the [[family|son]] of [[radagon of the golden order|Radagon]] and [[queen marika the eternal|Marika]]. He is cursed with perpetual [[child|youth]]. He has [[very long hair|very long]], [[blonde hair]], with either a [[crown braid]] or [[half up braid]], narrow [[twin braids]] to the sides and additional [[braid]]s in the back, with the rest of his hair free, and is typically seen wearing a [[white robe]]. Miquella appears as an important character in [[elden ring: shadow of the erdtree|Shadow of the Erdtree]].

[spoilers]There are a number of hints that [[St. Trina (elden ring)|Saint Trina]], an enigmatic figure named and referenced in several [[sleeping|sleep]] and [[dreaming|dream]] related items, was a [[disguise]] used by Miquella when travelling afar.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]Miquella was spirited away by [[Mohg Lord of Blood|Mohg]] prior to the start of the game for his own nefarious purposes. By the time the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] sees him, he has been encased in a [[cocoon]] where he has begun [[transformation|changing]].[/spoilers]

title: lillie_(pokemon)
body: A character from [[Pokemon|Pokémon]], introduced in [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[green eyes]]. She's often depicted with her companion [[Pokemon (creature)|Pokemon]], [[Cosmog]]. She has two official outfits. The first includes a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]]. It also sometimes includes a [[white hat|white]] [[sun hat]] and a [[Poke ball theme|Poké ball-themed]] [[duffel bag]]. The second outfit includes a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] and a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt]], along with [[white footwear|white]] [[mary janes]]. She also sometimes wears a [[pink bag|pink]] [[backpack]]. Lillie's hair is [[official alternate hairstyle|sometimes worn]] in a [[ponytail with braided base|ponytail with a braided base]]. h4. title: boolossus
body:
A portrait [[ghost]] to be captured in [i][[Luigi's Mansion]][/i].

Known as the [b]Jumbo Ghost[/b], it is a [[Big Boo]] comprised of the fusion of many smaller normal [[Boo_(mario)|]]s. 

Unlike normal Boos, Boolossus is much larger, has [[yellow eyes]] and the area around it's eyes is darkened.

Boolossus' was captured by [[Professor Elvin Gadd]] prior to the events of Luigi's Mansion. In retaliation, [[King Boo]] in rage attacked E. Gadd's lab to free Boolossus, the rest of the Portrait Ghosts and then created the Mansion, kickstarting the events of the game.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25224302

title: summer_pockets
body:
Summer Pockets is a Japanese visual novel video game developed by [[Key (company)|]], a brand of VisualArt's. It was released on June 29, 2018 for Windows and is rated for all ages.

Summer Pockets is Key's 13th game.

title: fender_jazz_bass
body:
A [[bass guitar]] first released by [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]] in 1960. It is one of the most popular bass guitars alongside its older sibling - the [[Fender Precision Bass]], originally released as a bass counterpart to the [[Fender Jazzmaster]], featuring a focus on brighter sounds as opposed to its older sibling. It often is called "J Bass".

Visual differences with the Precision Bass include a more angular, skewed body and a more curved pickguard along with two straight pickups being the most common configuration.

[[Akiyama Mio]] is the most prominent character who plays a Jazz Bass. Other known players include [[Kazusa (band) (blue archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]] and [[Kouyama Rin]] and [[Taguchi Ryuuya]] from [[Futsuu no Keion-bu]].

h4. See also
h5. Electric Guitars
* [[Fender Telecaster]]
* [[Fender Jaguar]]

title: riding_crop
body:
A short, semi-rigid whip without a lash. Normally used for horse riding, but nowadays more often associated with BDSM.

Riding crops are often confused with teachers' [[pointer]]s.  A riding crop usually has some flex to it and often widens and flattens into a rectangular shape at its very tip. Pointers are usually thinner, completely rigid and may have an oblong cushion on the end. Even artists sometimes conflate the two.

h4. See also

title: rocket_propelled_chainsaw
body:
Rocket Propelled Chainsaw, also known as Rocket Chainsaw and RPC M1B, is a fictional weapon that gained legendary status as one of the most advanced and awesome lethal piece of equipment ever conceived by the internet, with maximum efficiency against zombie creatures. On iFunny, Rocket Chainsaw has a status that of a mascot due to being one of the first images to be featured on the app. It also appears in the game [[Cortex Command]] as a weapon for the Ronin faction. 

https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/rocket-propelled-chainsaw

title: holy_grail_(fate)
body:
A golden goblet that is the ultimate prize of the Holy Grail Wars in the [[fate (series)|Fate series]]. It is capable of granting the victor's wish. It was corrupted by [[Angra Mainyu (fate)|]] during the third Holy Grail War, which would distort any wish made upon it in the two future Holy Grail Wars to be the destruction of the world.

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], there are several instances where multiple Holy Grails were used by the main antagonists to fulfil their plans. The player were tasked to retrieve the Grail by defeating the antagonists, thus the Holy Grails are earned after completing a major story arc or in some events. They can then be consumed to perform Palingenesis, a [[gameplay mechanics|gameplay mechanic]] that increases a Servant's maximum combat level, up to level 120. This is an optional mechanic that players can utilize, so illustrations depicting FGO Servants with a Grail tend to demonstrate that the artist boosted them in their own games.

h4.See also

* [[Grail-kun]]
* [[Summon Ticket (fate)|]]
* [[Chaldean visionary flames]]
* [[Golden Apple]] (Golden Fruit)
** [[Silver Apple]] (Silver Fruit)
* [[Mana Prism]]
** [[Rare Prism]]
* [[Saint Quartz (fate)|]]
** [[Saint Quartz Fragment]]

title: gooey_bomb
body:
Explosive devices found in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] video game series. They are encased in a sticky substance that allows it to adhere to surfaces and opponents. Once attached, the bomb counts down and explodes, causing damage to anyone nearby. A Gooey Bomb can be passed on to other players by contact, similar to a game of hot potato.

Known as the Chewing Bomb (チューインボム) in Japan.

title: horsebit_loafers
body:
A classic style of slip-on [[shoes|shoe]] characterized by a metal (usually brass) ornament across the vamp that resembles a [[horse]]'s bit.

The [[Gucci]] version is iconic, but many other brands offer their own takes on the design.

title: queen_of_hatred
body:
An abnormality from [[Lobotomy Corporation]], initially known as "Magical Girl". She also appears in [[Library of Ruina]].

In her human form, she has blue to purple gradient hair, wearing a pink vest, pink skirt, large bow atop the vest, heart hair ornament, white thigh-highs with pink garter straps, and pink shoes. She is accompanied by a large staff that is topped with a winged star containing a heart symbol.

In her monstrous form, she resembles a large winged snake, primarily blue with a pink underbelly, as well as having purple and pink feathers, two limbs at the snake's head, and empty black eyes.

* !post #6132161: Human form in foreground, with transformed form in background.

Associated with [[Knight of Despair]] and [[King of Greed]] from [[Lobotomy Corporation]], as well as [[Servant of Wrath]] from [[Wonderlab]] and [[The Jester of Nihil]] from [[Library of Ruina]].

The EGO associated with her is [[In the Name of Love and Hate (E.G.O)]].

title: chain-link_fence
body:
A type of woven [[fence]] usually made from galvanized or LLDPE-coated steel [[wire]]. The wire runs vertically and is bent into a zig-zag pattern so each "zig" is quickly trapped on one side with the wire and each "zag" with the wire quickly traps the other. This forms the characteristic [[diamond (shape)|]] pattern or [[mesh]] seen on this type of fence.

h4. See also

* [[bamboo fence]]
* [[iron fence]]
* [[wooden fence]]
** [[picket fence]]

title: corrin_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Corrin[/b] (Kamui) is the main protagonist of [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

Supposedly born to Hoshidan royalty, Corrin was kidnapped at an early age and raised in Nohr. As Corrin comes of age, they find themselves the subject of a stirring conflict between the two nations and must choose families, deciding the course of fate.

Much like Kris in [i][[Fire Emblem: New Mystery of the Emblem]][/i] and Robin in [i][[Fire Emblem Awakening]][/i], Corrin is an avatar character, with their name, gender, appearance, and voice customizable by the player. As such, some media refers to Corrin as simply the [b]Avatar[/b] (マイユニット My Unit).

Corrin is a descendant of the First Dragons. Carrying ancient dragon blood, they are able to tap the power of Dragon Veins to manipulate the territory around them. They are also able to turn into a [[dragon]], though they normally only do so involuntarily and out of insanity. As a result, Corrin keeps a [[dragonstone]] on their person to assume full control of their transforming powers.

Corrin's dragon form and gentle personality are strongly based on the [i][[qilin (mythology)|]][/i], a chimerical creature that, in Chinese mythology, primarily symbolizes benevolence and fortune. It is said to foretell the birth or arrival of an illustrious ruler or great human being.

Male Corrin has [[short hair|short]], [[spiked hair]], while female Corrin has [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair]] and [[juliet sleeves]], and wears a black [[headband]], often along with a Nohrian [[hairpin]]. They have [[red eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and [[bangs]] that drape over their forehead and slightly to the side. By default, they wear a silver [[cuirass]] with gray and black accents, as well as a [[collar]] with [[buckle]]s on the sides. It is worn over black clothing that covers Corrin's hands, and their [[arm guards]] broaden just below shoulder height.

Corrin also sports a long [[blue cape]] that wraps around their right hip and upwards against their back and is fastened by a [[brooch]] on their [[breastplate]]. Their [[leg armor]] notably does not cover their thighs, which are either completely covered (male Corrin) or [[thigh cutout|exposed]] (female Corrin) by their [[leggings]]. An additional [[kusazuri]]-like piece of leather covers their left thigh. They are almost always seen [[barefoot]], wielding the legendary [[sword]] [[Yato (fire_emblem)|]].

In Japanese, male Corrin is voiced by [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]], while female Corrin is voiced by [[Satou Satomi]]. They cover all the customizable voice options in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i], although their written dialogue differs between options (including a completely silent one).

In English, male Corrin is voiced by "Cam Clarke":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cam_Clarke, with certain voice options in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i] voiced by [[Yuri Lowenthal]]. Similarly, Female Corrin is voiced by Marcella Lentz-Pope, with the other voice options in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i] voiced by Danielle Judovits and "Stephanie Lemelin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephanie_Lemelin.

[b]Starting Class:[/b] Nohr Prince/Nohr Princess

h4. Appearance

* !post #1971613: [[corrin (male) (fire emblem)|Male]]
* !post #1971614: [[corrin (female) (fire emblem)|Female]]

title: hoshikawa_lily
body:
[[Zombie Land Saga]] character.

The youngest member of the [[idol]] group Franchouchou. She was reanimated 7 years later in order to join the [[Zombie Land Saga]] Project. 

When in zombie form, her [[heart out of chest|heart often sits outside her chest]]. It's able to be concealed for public appearances, but will come out if she is shocked.

She was born in [[Saga Prefecture]], and spoke in Saga dialect before becoming a TV star.

[spoiler]Her birth name is Go Masao, and she was born male. Her cause of death was a heart attack resulting from a combination of being overworked and [[gender dysphoria]]: the sudden shock upon discovering she'd grown facial hair after hitting puberty.

When tagging use [[1girl]] for normal appearances and [[1boy]] and [[otoko no ko]] when her body or former identity is directly referenced.
[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Tanaka Minami (voice actor)|]].

title: campaign_hat
body:
A campaign hat (also campaign cover, drill instructor cover, drill sergeant hat, lemon squeezer, Montana Peak, Mountie hat, ranger hat, sergeant hat, Scouts hat and Smokey Bear) is a broad-brimmed felt or straw hat, with a high crown, pinched symmetrically at the four corners (the "Montana crease").


It is associated with the [[New Zealand]] Army, the [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]], the [[World War I]] ground forces of the [[United States Army]], contemporary U.S. military drill instructors, US state police forces, park rangers (and from them, their logo-cartoon and mascot Smokey Bear), Boy Scouts, and others.


Although the campaign hat is occasionally referred to as a Stetson, this is from its common manufacture in the late 19th century by that company. It should not be confused with the quite different Stetson hat type with a different brim and crease, commonly known as the cowboy hat, and which is more commonly meant by the term "Stetson" today. The campaign hat also should not be confused with a slouch hat.


Several U.S. state police services (for example, the Utah Highway Patrol), and federal agencies (for example, the United States Border Patrol) wear campaign hats. These state troopers are responsible for state and interstate highway safety, and in this capacity are variously referred to in different states as State Police, Highway Patrol, State Patrol, and State Highway Patrol. So common is use of the campaign hat among state highway police that they are sometimes referred to as "smokey bears" or "smokeys," after Smokey Bear the famous logo-character of the U.S. Forest Service. The only State Police agencies that do not employ the “smokey bear hat”, are the New York State Police, Connecticut State Police, New Jersey State Police, Texas Highway Patrol, Maryland State Police, New Mexico State Police, and the Michigan State Police. There is no direct association between the cartoon bear and the Highway Patrol; they both derive their hat styles ultimately from the U.S. Cavalry.

Many other [[police]] agencies, including numerous county [[sheriff (contemporary)|]]s' services including the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department, use campaign hats. Some local police use it for particular duties or divisions; for example, officers of the [[Los Angeles Police Department]]'s and [[Chicago Police Department]]'s mounted units employ the hat, and deputy sheriffs assigned as cadre of the Cook County Sheriff's Boot Camp wear campaign hats.

title: jamitov_hymen
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] universe. He first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]Jamitov Hymen[/b] is the mastermind behind the foundation and rise of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]], the elite organization of the [[Earth Federation]] Forces. 

From his perch at the pinnacle of the Earth Federation's [[military]] command structure, Jamitov uses the Titans as a private army to further his own scheme for world domination. Cruel, devious, and utterly amoral, Jamitov will stop at nothing to impose his own brand of Earth-supremacist ideology on the suffering peoples of the [[space]] colonies. 

[spoilers]Dies at the end of The Gryps War shot to death by [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who betrayed Jamitov in order to gain total control of the Titans army.[/spoilers]

title: about:danbooru
body:
This page records key parts of Danbooru history in a timeline format. Currently work in progress, featuring Danbooru-adjacent developments, archived link usage to be examined.

h3. Early Danbooru

h5. 2005-05-17
@albert launched Danbooru.
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/422":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070320185536mp_/http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/422]

h5. 2005-05-24
Danbooru's first update was pushed, database is reset in the meantime;
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/432":[http://web.archive.org/web/20060507181600/http://memo.donmai.us:80/post/view/432]
post #1 was uploaded, and thus is considered Danbooru's birthday.

h6. 2005-10-01
Shimmie went live, inspired by Danbooru (though initially built on Futaba and Ajax more).
"http://shish.is-a-geek.net/projects/shimmie/about.php":[https://web.archive.org/web/20060117055149/http://shish.is-a-geek.net/projects/shimmie/about.php] circa 2006-01-17

h6. by 2006-11-17
Moe.imouto.org went live (earliest instance of Moebooru/yande.re).
"http://imouto.org/blog/2006/11/":[https://web.archive.org/web/20071016112852/http://imouto.org/blog/2006/11/]

h6. 2006-11-18
Albert acknowledges Shimmie, wishing Shish the best of luck.
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/652":[https://web.archive.org/web/20070317033443/http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/652]

h6. 2007-01-19
post #100000 was uploaded.

h5. 2007-03-02
Albert publicly took down Danbooru to work on improvements; subsequently released original source code, spawning many booru-style imageboards to come;
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/1107":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070304073155/http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/1107] circa 2007-03-04
"http://danbooru.donmai.us":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070322233209/http://danbooru.donmai.us:80/] circa 2007-03-22
The site would remain available to select users in the form of a private closed beta, through miezaru.donmai.us (forum #3261).

h6. 2007-03-07
Earliest pre-release public appearance of Shimmie 2 was launched.

h5. 2007-XX-XX
Version updates to Danbooru's code continue, with 1.1.0 releasing 2007-03-10, setting up Trac on 2007-03-11, 1.2.0 on 2007-03-15, 1.3.2 on 2007-03-26, 1.4.0 on 2007-03-31, 1.4.1 on 2007-04-02, 1.4.2 on 2007-04-05, and 1.5.0. sometime around 2007-04-25, with some smaller blog posts here and there. 
"http://memo.donmai.us/":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070312155721/http://memo.donmai.us/] circa 2007-03-12
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/1119":[http://web.archive.org/web/20071225110247mp_/http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/1119] circa 2007-12-25
"http://memo.donmai.us/?page=3":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070408080946/http://memo.donmai.us/?page=3] circa 2007-04-08
"http://memo.donmai.us/?page=2":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070408080946/http://memo.donmai.us/?page=2] circa 2007-04-08
"http://memo.donmai.us/":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070408080946/http://memo.donmai.us/] circa 2007-04-08

h3. Modern Danbooru

h5. 2007-XX-XX
Danbooru went live once more; miezaru.donmai.us would be used for the invite-only open public testing, while danbooru.donmai.us was used for Q&A, source code and links to 'booru alternatives.
"http://danbooru.donmai.us":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070605204007/http://danbooru.donmai.us:80/] circa 2007-06-05

h6. 2007-04-XX
Rule34.paheal.us went live (Paheal being derived from Filipino Ragnarok Online slang meaning "please heal").

h6. 2007-04-21
Shimmie 2 went properly live.

h6. 2007-05-XX
Gelbooru went live.

h5. 2007-09-06
Registration became available once more (topic #167).

h5. by 2007-10-16
Danbooru.donmai.us once more directed to the front page.
"http://danbooru.donmai.us":[http://web.archive.org/web/20071016094743/http://danbooru.donmai.us:80/] circa 2007-10-16

h5. around 2007-12
Standard users couldn't search for multiple tags anymore (topic #473).

h5. 2009-03-03
Notdanbooru.donmai.us was launched, filtering out explicit and questionable posts; was renamed to Safebooru.donmai.us two days later (topic #4414).

h6. 2010-01-29
Safebooru.org went live.

h6. 2010-11-12
Rule34.xxx went live.

h6. 2011-09-20
post #1000000 was uploaded.

h5. 2012-12-21
Albert announced plans to upgrade Danbooru on 2013-02-16 (topic #8830).

h5. 2013-02-16
Danbooru received its announced upgrade to Danbooru 2, danbooru.donmai.us directed directly to Posts now; relevant thread and forum in general was filled with bug reports and varying opinions on the upgrade.

h6. 2015-05-01
post #2000000 was uploaded.

h5. 2015-07-07
Janitor level was removed (topic #11837).

h5. 2015-10-23
Contributor level was removed.

h6. 2017-05-06
@evazion created the Danbooru Discord server (topic #14030).

h6. 2018-01-27
post #3000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2018-03-21
Uploader names were obscured, replaced with Top Tagger in efforts to curb some bad practices (topic #14857, topic #15088).

h6. 2019-01-30
Top Tagger was hidden (topic #15916).

h6. 2019-11-29
UA College of C&IS researcher Dr. Brian C. Britt published an article entitled [i]Content Curation, Evaluation, and Refinement on a Nonlinearly Directed Imageboard: Lessons From Danbooru[/i] ("doi.org/10.1177/2056305119880020":[https://doi.org/10.1177%2F2056305119880020]), discussing the site in detail, a month after invoking Danbooru in his article [i]The use of nondialogic trolling to disrupt online communication[/i] ("doi.org/10.5210/fm.v24i10.10164":[https://doi.org/10.5210/fm.v24i10.10164]).

h5. 2019-12-06
Albert resigned from his position of Danbooru owner, and declared evazion as his successor (topic #16472).

h4. evazion era

h6. 2020-02-25
Super Voters were removed along with the Curated pool (forum #163413).

h6. 2020-05-13
Danbooru Discord server was sponsored on the main page for a couple of weeks. It jumped from around 100 users to around 4000 in a matter of days.

h6. 2020-06-13
Following discussion, Danbooru's romanization system switched from a strictly Hepburn system to a more permissive one based on the system used by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan for their passports. (forum #168056, topic #17011).

h5. 2020-07-07
[[Paid Reward]]s were banned from Danbooru (topic #17092).
Some rules were rewritten (topic #17091).

h6. 2020-07-14
post #4000000 was uploaded.

h5. 2020-07-15
Uploader names were back (topic #15924, forum #169413).

h6. 2021-05-22
Danbooru's 16th birthday (topic #18552).

h6. 2021-12-23
post #5000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2022-05-07
Danbooru got banned from Stripe, preventing users from upgrading to gold.

h5. 2022-05-22
{{Rating:General}} was introduced. Rating:Safe was renamed {{Rating:Sensitive}}. (topic #21277)
Safebooru.donmai.us would be renamed to "donmai.moe":https://donmai.moe/ by this day (forum #213208)

h6. 2022-06-04
Danbooru launched new upgrade code system, to sell codes for gold membership on Shopify.

h6. 2022-06-29
Danbooru was banned from Shopify. Gold upgrades are disabled once again and remain so long-term.

h6. 2022-09-25
NovelAI "announced":https://twitter.com/novelaiofficial/status/1573844864390791169 on Twitter that they have been using Danbooru to train their artwork AI.

h6. 2022-10-03
A Japanese Twitter user "pointed out":https://twitter.com/fugakura/status/1576820035842023424 that NovelAI has been using Danbooru to train their artwork AI. Some mistakenly interpreted this as outright support on Danbooru's end, and the news got traction. In the following days hundreds of artists asked Danbooru to take down their artworks for various reasons. This led to AI-generated artworks being added to the list of prohibited content (forum #223144).

h5. 2022-10-30
The Contributor user level was back alongside Approver, fully replacing the "unrestricted uploads" and "approve posts" Builder permissions.

h6. 2023-01-20
post #6000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2023-12-19
post #7000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2024-08-14
post #8000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2025-03-15
post #9000000 was uploaded.

h4. See also
* [[Help:Home]]
* topic #18008 - thread where the timeline is discussed

h3. External historical links
* "Moetry":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070304121219/http://memo.donmai.us/], Albert's original blog (2004-02-29 to 2011-01-05)
* "Trac (Danbooru 1)":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070323140301/http://trac.donmai.us/] (2007-03-11 to July-August 2012)
* "Google Code (Danbooru 1)":[https://code.google.com/archive/p/danbooru/] and "Subversion Repo":[https://storage.googleapis.com/google-code-archive-source/v2/code.google.com/danbooru/repo.svndump.gz] ("git version":[https://github.com/danbooru1/danbooru]; latest commit 2010-07-15)
* "Notes From Danbooru":[https://notesfromdanbooru.wordpress.com/], Albert's post-Moetry blog (2011-05-07 to 2012-12-21)

title: higanbana_no_saku_yoru_ni
body:
Lit. [i]On the Night the Red [[Spider Lily]] Blooms[/i]

A visual novel and 2010-2012 manga by [[Ryuukishi07]] and 07th Expansion of [i][[Higurashi no Naku Koro ni]][/i] and [i][[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]][/i], with illustrations by Tsunohazu Ichirou, serialized in Fujimi Shobo's [i]Monthly Dragon Age[/i]. 

It originally began as [i]Gakkou Youkai Kikou: Dai-hachi Kaidan Boshuuchuu[/i] (学校妖怪紀行 第八怪談募集中), lit. [i]School Youkai Traveler's Guide: Recruiting the Eighth Kaidan[/i], a 2007 light novel serialized in Fujimi Shobo's [i]Dragon Age Pure[/i], with illustrations by [[Nishieda]], which ran for three chapters before being discontinued. 

It was then followed by the manga [i]Gakkou Youkai Kikou - You[/i] (学校妖怪紀行 ~葉~), with illustrations by [[Izumi Rei]], which was also serialized in [i]Dragon Age Pure[/i] in 2007 before ending after two chapters.

title: aries_muu
body: A [[Saint Seiya]] character. The [[Gold Saint]] of the Aries Cloth. He has the ability to restore any Cloth to a pristine and often stronger condition, thanks to his family's tradition of Cloth repair. Has an apprentice in a young boy named [[kiki_(saint_seiya)|Kiki]].

title: kokoa_remon_(primagista)
body:
[[Kokoa Remon]]'s Primagista performer form.

Remon has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]], mainly [[blonde hair]], with [[sidelocks]], [[blunt bangs]], [[double bun|double]] [[braided bun]]s, and [[colored inner hair|inner parts dyed]] [[blue]]; with the bottom [[drill hair|drills]] [[gradient hair|gradually dyed]] into an aqua tone. She also has dark [[red lips]], [[red eyeshadow]] applied to her eyelids and a bat wing-shaped [[facial mark]].
Her [[idol clothes|main outfit]] consists of a [[black hairband]] with a [[crown]]-shaped hat and [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]] attached to it, [[earrings]], a [[gothic lolita]] [[black dress]] with a [[gold trim]], a [[stained glass print]], a [[collared dress|collar]], [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[juliet sleeves]] that [[wide sleeves|widen]] at the bottom, and a [[crinoline]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[high heels|high heeled]] [[black shoes]].

title: saint_seiya
body:
[b]Saint Seiya[/b], also known as [b]Saint Seiya: Knights of the Zodiac[/b], is a 1986 Japanese [[fantasy]] and [[martial arts]] action manga series created, written and illustrated by [[Kurumada Masami (style)|]].

It was serialized first in [[Weekly Shounen Jump]] from 1986 to 1990, with the chapters collected into 28 tankōbon volumes by Shueisha. 

The story follows five mystical warriors called the "Saints" (or "Knights" in some adaptations) who fight wearing sacred armors named "Cloths", the designs of which derive from the various constellations the characters have adopted as their destined guardian symbols, and empowered by a mystical energy called "Cosmo". The Saints have sworn to defend the reincarnation of the benevolent Greek goddess [[Athena (saint seiya)|]] in her battle against other evil Olympian and Norse mythology gods who want to dominate Earth.

The manga was adapted into an anime television series by [[Toei Animation]] with character designs and art by [[Araki Shingo]] that ran from 1986 to 1989, before being continued in the form of three original video animation series between 2002 and 2008. 

Four animated feature films were shown in Japanese theaters from 1987 to 1989, with a fifth in 2004 and a sixth in 2014. 

Since 2006, creator Kurumada published a sequel manga titled [[Saint Seiya: Next Dimension]]. Several spin-off manga by different authors have also been created, as well as a standalone anime and original net animation.

Saint Seiya has been very successful, with over 34 million copies sold in Japan alone. The series began to be known in the west after it became popular in France in 1988, where it was given the French name of [i]Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque[/i]; this was also the first foreign release of the series. Since the early 90s the series also became very popular in Spanish-speaking countries after it was released in Spain as "Los Caballeros del Zodiaco". 

Because of its popularity many RPG, action and fighting video games based on the series have been released in the last decades.

h4. Characters

title: power_rangers_megaforce
body:
The eighteenth [[Power Rangers]] series, largely adapting stock footage from [[Tensou Sentai Goseiger]], and followed up by the nineteenth series in [i]Power Rangers Super Megaforce[/i], which largely adapts stock footage from [[Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger]].

Due to Gokaiger featuring a transformation gimmick which allows its team to transform into Past Rangers in the Legendary [[Ranger Key]]s, several Sentai teams which hadn't been adapted into Power Rangers were represented as "New Powers" and received Ranger names, in-show or otherwise. [[Kagaku Sentai Dynaman]] became the Battalion Rangers, [[Dengeki Sentai Changeman]] became the Blitz Rangers, [[Choushinsei Flashman]] became the Prism Rangers, [[Hikari Sentai Maskman]] became the Lightning Rangers, [[Chikyuu Sentai Fiveman]] became the Supersonic Rangers, and [[Gosei Sentai Dairanger]] became the Squadron Rangers (Star Force pre-Super Megaforce).
other_names: パワーレンジャー・メガフォース
パワーレンジャー・スーパーメガフォース

title: power_rangers_s.p.d.
body:
The 12th [[Power Rangers]] series, based on [[Tokusou Sentai Dekaranger]].

Dekaranger's popularity in Japan was so immense that a Japanese dub of S.P.D. was made, featuring the original Dekaranger cast members dubbing over their American counterparts, earning it the rare privilege of a Ranger season being dubbed into Japanese.

The main team would be referred to as S.P.D. B-Squad, with A-Squad disappearing prior to the events of the story, only to eventually return as Evil Rangers whom the B-Squad has to defeat. They would be the first Evil Rangers since [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers|Mighty Morphin]] with unique suits, consisting of recycled [[Power Rangers in Space|Space Ranger]] helmets with Galactic Space Alliance armor from [[Power Rangers Lost Galaxy|Lost Galaxy]].

h4. See also

* [[S.P.D. Uniform]]
* [[SP License]]

title: enigmatic_recollection
body:
[i]It is a collection of stories in which the members of [[hololive English]] play a part.
Through streams, animations, and songs wrought anew, immerse yourself in fresh narratives woven from myriad realms beyond.[/i]

A multimedia hololive English project, primarily centered around a modded [[Minecraft]] roleplay.

* !post #8039658: Poster

h3. Synopsis
Once upon a time, the girls are summoned to the mysterious Kingdom of Libestal.
Unable to remember anything from before their arrival, they become entangled in the kingdom's conflicts.
The girls are asked to defend the land from looming danger and are thusly entrusted with the kingdom's fate.

Ominous creatures----
ENigmatic stories lost within the kingdom-----
What fate awaits them at the end of it all? 

h3. Main characters
h6. Scarlet Wand
* [[Cecilia Immergreen]]
* [[Ceres Fauna]]
* [[Gawr Gura]] (Gumbo Gumbo)
* [[Nerissa Ravencroft]]
* [[Shiori Novella]] (Shiori of the Nyavellas)
h6. Amber Coin
* [[Hakos Baelz]] (Peasant the Bae)
* [[Nanashi Mumei]] (Nanamu)
* [[Raora Panthera]] (Queen Mario)
* [[Takanashi Kiara]] (Tanakisha Karia/Shakira)
h6. Cerulean Cup
* [[Gigi Murin]] (Sir Gonathon G)
* [[Irys_(hololive)|IRyS]] (The Hot Pink One)
* [[Koseki Bijou]] (Princess Bijou/[spoiler]Stain Princess Bijou[/spoiler])
* [[Ninomae Ina'nis]] (Princess Nino Ina)
* [[Ouro Kronii]] (Queen Tam Gandr)
h6. Jade Sword
* [[Elizabeth Rose Bloodflame]] (Lady Bloodflame)
* [[Fuwawa Abyssgard]]
* [[Mococo Abyssgard]]
* [[Mori Calliope]] (Calliopeen)
* [[Watson Amelia]] (Jyonathan Watson)

h3. See also

* [[holoEarth Chronicles]]
* [[holoEarth]]

title: ressha_sentai_toqger
body:
The 38th [[Super Sentai]] series, with its title literally meaning [i]Express Squad ToQger[/i]. It features a train motif. On February 16, 2014, it replaced [[Zyuden Sentai Kyoryuger]] on the Super Hero Time block on TV Asahi, and would be replaced by [[Shuriken Sentai Ninninger]] on February 22, 2015.

ToQger would be the first Sentai series to be wholly skipped over for a [[Power Rangers]] adaptation, in favor of its successor Ninninger, though villain suits would be reused in later series.

title: azure_striker_gunvolt_1
body:
A 2014 side-scrolling video game by Inti Creates for the [[Nintendo 3DS]] eShop.

The game takes place in a distant future where those born with psychic powers known as "Adapts" (EN) / "Seventh" (JP) are feared and oppressed on a regular basis by those without. A major world-wide conglomerate known as the Sumuragi Group tasked themselves into bringing peace to Adapts under their "Psychic Protection" program, but unbeknownst to the world, their so-called plan for peace turned out to be what amounts to concentration camps where a series of cruel and inhumane experiments are performed on Adapts under their program. A resistance group known as QUILL (EN) / FEATHER (JP) however surfaced in attempt to stop their atrocities. One of their newest members, a 14-year-old Adapt boy known only by his codename, "[[Gunvolt]]", who also possesses the titular "Azure Striker" (EN) / "Armed Blue" (JP) septima, the ability to control electricity and lightning. During one mission where Gunvolt is tasked to stop Sumuragi's plans to steal the cyber diva [[Lumen (gunvolt)|]] (EN) / Morpho (JP) and her septima of "The Muse" to control Adapts across the world then destroy her, Gunvolt however he discovers that the cyber diva was not a computer programmed idol, but rather the manifestation of a young girl's septimal powers named [[Joule (gunvolt)|]] (EN) / Cyan (JP). Not wishing to see Joule suffer through the same kind of oppression he went through, Gunvolt boldly went against his orders and rescues her from her captors.

h4. Characters

h5. Main characters

* [[Joule (gunvolt)|Cyan (JP) / Joule (EN)]]

title: chuunibyou
body:
Often translated to English as "8th-Grader Syndrome". A similar insult in English is calling someone "edgy".

Japanese stereotypical depiction of delusional people who attempted to stand out by believing that one has special powers (especially sealed powers), a dark past, or such like. Chuunibyou can manifest as overly dramatic [[hand over eye|hand gestures]], expressions, and spoken lines; and clothing such as [[eyepatch]]es and [[scarf|scarves]]. If the symptoms are severe enough, even [i]actually[/i] having special powers and/or a dark past may not be enough to beat chuunibyou allegations.

Only tag images where a character is actively displaying chuunibyou behavior; do not use simply because the character is a chuunibyou in the series. The tag is not meant as an abbreviation of the light novel series [[Chuunibyou Demo Koi ga Shitai!]].

h4. Examples

* !post #1807620: [[Takanashi Rikka]] - [i][[Chuunibyou Demo Koi ga Shitai!]][/i]
* !post #5920592: [[Guillotine (nikke)|]] - [i][[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]][/i]
* !post #4668778: [[Fischl (genshin impact)|]] - [i][[Genshin Impact]][/i]
* !post #8805374: [[Dushevnaya (girls' frontline 2)|]] - [i][[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]][/i]
* !post #6489019: [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] - [i][[Love Live! Sunshine!!]][/i]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chūnibyō":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch%C5%ABniby%C5%8D

title: arona_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. [[Sensei (blue archive)|]]'s virtual assistant residing in the Shittim Chest.

She is the main mascot of Blue Archive, appearing as the figurehead on its website and social media. In addition to providing information and updates to Sensei, she also runs a series of videos called Arona Channel, as well as being the one who is representing the in-game [[gacha (game mechanic)|]] mechanics by randomly giving the player an envelope representing student's application.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[light blue hair|blue hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair|undertones]], worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]]. She has [[mismatched pupils]]: her right pupil is [[blue pupils|blue]] while her left pupil is [[pink pupils|pink]].

Voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5441079: Default

h4. See also

* [[Plana (Blue Archive)|]]
* [[General Student Council President (Blue Archive)|]]

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Arona":[https://bluearchive.fandom.com/wiki/Arona]

title: recursion
body:
[[Recursion]] is when a concept depends on itself.

In artwork, this often takes the form of the [b]Droste effect[/b], in which the image contains a smaller version of itself within it, and that smaller version contains an even smaller version, and so on.

Can also refer to other forms of self-reference.

h4. See also

* [[clone]]
* [[fractal]]
* [[mirror]]
* [[recurring image]]
* [[recursion]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Recursion":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recursion]

title: carrying_pole
body:
Carrying pole, shoulder pole, milkmaid's yoke (...), is a yoke, used by people to [[carrying_over_shoulder|carry]] a load. It might be used in one of two basic ways:

* A single person balances the yoke over one shoulder, with an evenly distributed load being suspended from each end.
* Two people support the yoke by resting it on a shoulder, with the load suspended from the centre of the yoke.

h4. Styles

* [[Milkmaid's yoke]]

h4. See also

* [[Yoke]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carrying_pole

title: milkmaid's_yoke
body: A milkmaid's yoke or shoulder yoke is a style of [[carrying pole]] that features a widened portion for the shoulders and a curve to accommodate being fit around the neck.
